column2:
Fatman cadde al suolo con un tonfo
rivoltante. Snake guard quella massa
corpulenta. Il petto di Fatman si alzava e
abbassava a fatica. Sarebbe sopravvissuto.
|
Snake chiam Campbell con il Codec e gli
disse cos'era successo. Campbell gli
comunic che il Presidente era al sicuro, in
custodia della Guardia Costiera. Inoltre,
mentre Snake affrontava Fatman, i SEAL
della Marina erano entrati nell'impianto e si
stavano occupando degli ultimi terroristi
rimasti.
|
"Perch non l'hai ammazzato?"
Snake si volt e vide Ames alle sue spalle.
"Perch? Io ti dovrei fare la stessa
domanda: perch hai lasciato andare il
Presidente?"
"Cosa?"
"Fatman mi ha detto tutto. Tu dovevi fare la
guardia al Presidente."
Ames si mise a ridere.
"Fatman? E tu credi a quello che dice
Fatman?"
Snake non batt ciglio.
"Certo... Tu eri d'accordo con Fatman?"
"Mai."
"Ah davvero?"
Snake avanz verso Ames, che stese una
mano per fermarlo.
"Aspetta un minuto! Ti rendi conto di cosa
stai dicendo? Non l'avrebbe mai fatto!"
disse Jennifer, che era sbucata
all'improvviso. Doveva essere stata liberata
dai SEAL.
"Come fai a esserne sicura?" replic
Snake, tenendo gli occhi fissi su Ames.
"Perch  stato Richard ad aiutare il
Presidente a fuggire!"
"Ma di cosa parli?"
I conti non tornavano: Fatman era sembrato
sincero, ma era anche vero che Ames aveva
collaborato con Snake. E ora Jennifer stava
dicendo che Ames aveva aiutato il
Presidente a fuggire. Anche se Fatman
avesse mentito e se Jennifer avesse detto
la verit, allora perch Ames non gli aveva
detto che il Presidente era al sicuro?
Mentre Snake rifletteva in silenzio sulla
faccenda, Jennifer prosegu: "Richard  uno
dei nostri migliori agenti. Inoltre 
impossibile che sia coinvolto in un attentato
terroristico. Dopotutto, sua sorella..."
"Jennifer!" la interruppe Ames, ma lei lo
ignor.
"Richard ha perso la sorella minore in un
attentato terroristico. Tre anni fa..."
A Snake vennero i brividi. Si ricord tutte le
sue parole. Tre anni fa - un attentato
terroristico - la sorella - la chiesa - Fatman.
Snake ricord lo strano comportamento di
Ames, che aveva sputato mentre diceva che
Fatman era stato assolto. Si era infervorato
nella convinzione che la giuria avesse
sbagliato con Fatman. Lo sguardo che
aveva lanciato a Snake quando gli aveva
dato l'arma dicendogli "Promettimi che lo
ucciderai..." Ora aveva un'ipotesi.
Snake guard Ames. Dal suo volto non
trapelava alcuna espressione: niente panico,
n paura e nemmeno rabbia. L'ipotesi era
stata convalidata.
"Ames, il motivo per cui non mi hai detto
che avevi gi salvato il Presidente  che
pensavi che se lo avessi fatto, forse non
avrei ammazzato Fatman per conto tuo, o
sbaglio?"
Ames non rispose. Snake continu.
"Hai chiamato noi invece della polizia
perch era pi probabile che io avrei ucciso
Fatman invece di prenderlo vivo?"
"Ora basta!" grid Jennifer. Ames avvicin
ancora di pi la mano al petto.
"Fin dall'inizio avevi in mente di farmi
uccidere Fatman, non  cos? Tutto questo
..."
Improvvisamente Ames tir fuori una pistola
dal taschino. Snake reag immediatamente,
lanciandosi dietro una cassa vicina. Ma
Ames aveva puntato l'arma contro Fatman,
che giaceva bocconi. Strinse il grilletto.
"Fermo!"
Jennifer spinse la mano di Ames a lato,
facendogli mollare la presa. La pistola
volteggi in aria e cadde rumorosamente al
suolo. Ames si tuff come un disperato per
acciuffarla, ma con i suoi riflessi pronti,
Snake si allung e afferr la pistola prima
che lo facesse Ames. Disteso a terra, Ames
alz lo sguardo verso Snake; alla fine
abbass le spalle e si calm.
Jennifer avanz barcollando verso Ames.
"... Dimmi che non  vero..."
Ames scosse la testa lentamente.
"Ma allora  vero...?"
Ames si sedette, stanco, e guard verso il
cielo.
"S..."
Poi raccont la sua storia.
Dopo che la sorella era stata uccisa - e
Fatman l'aveva fatta franca - Ames aveva
iniziato a ordire la vendetta. Avvicinatosi a
un gruppo di estremisti con un piano per
rapire il Presidente, aveva assoldato Fatman
per fare il lavoro. Gli era costato una piccola
fortuna l'agente segreto ingaggiato per
scovare Fatman e convincerlo a partecipare.
Il resto era come l'aveva descritto Snake.
Ames voleva attirare Fatman nella Big Shell
e poi farlo uccidere da Snake. Tutto per la
sua cara, defunta sorella.
Jennifer si accovacci davanti ad Ames.
"Richard... perch non me l'hai detto..."
"Non  facile condividere una cosa del
genere, non credi?"
Jennifer gli moll un ceffone, poi inizi a
piangere. Ames distolse lo sguardo da lei.
"Non avrei mai voluto coinvolgerti. Non
dovevano esserci tutti quegli ostaggi, ma
solo il Presidente."
"No, non capisci."
Jennifer prese la mano di Ames e la strinse
nella sua, fissandolo negli occhi con
un'espressione supplichevole. Ma lui non
disse niente.
"Ci che hai fatto  un crimine."
Abbassata la testa in silenzio, Jennifer
sembrava aver perso ogni speranza. Ames
le rispose.
"Lo so. Ma Fatman deve essere punito."
"Ma niente di ci che ha fatto Fatman pu
giustificare ci che hai fatto tu!"
"Lo so che non posso riportare in vita mia
sorella. Ma mettiti nei miei panni per un
minuto. Pensi davvero che l'avresti
perdonato? Ha ucciso mia sorella, perdio!
E non ha passato neanche un giorno in
prigione per questo. Mia sorella non ha mai
avuto la possibilit di farsi una vita. E lui se
ne sta a bere champagne, a divertirsi con le
belle donne e a far saltare in aria la gente.
Non ti pare tremendamente ingiusto?"
"... Forse. Ma tu sei diventato un criminale
come lui."
"Scusa, ma io non la penso come la pensi
tu."
Ames allung il dito per asciugare le lacrime
di Jennifer.
"E adesso cos'hai intenzione di fare con
me?"
"Devo consegnarti alla polizia."
"Probabilmente mi daranno l'ergastolo."
"... Gi, penso di s."
Ames sospir. "Prima di andare, ti devo
chiedere un ultimo favore."
Jennifer alz lo sguardo verso di lui.
"Cosa?"
"Ti prego, lasciami uccidere quel bastardo."
Jennifer scosse la testa, con amarezza.
"Non posso fartelo fare."
"Ho capito... allora dovr trovarmi un altro
modo per farlo."
Ames gir la testa, mormorando fra s e s.
"Dio sa se ne avr di tempo per pensare."#C0

column2:
Snake entr nella sala riunioni. Gli ostaggi
erano l; a occhio e croce erano pi di 20. I
terroristi facevano la guardia alla zona,
comunicando spesso via radio. Al bench
minimo sospetto, l'area sarebbe stata invasa
dai rinforzi in un battere d'occhio. In quel
caso, non ci sarebbe stata via di scampo.
Snake doveva in qualche modo mettersi in
contatto con Jennifer senza farsi scoprire.
Ma c'era anche un altro problema: come
faceva a distinguere Jennifer tra gli
ostaggi? Snake chiam Campbell sul
Codec.
"Colonnello, questa Jennifer ha qualche
segno particolare che la distingue?"
"Mi spiace, ma non posso aiutarti."
"Perch no?"
"A quanto pare Jennifer ci sta inviando
e-mail mentre ha le mani legate dietro la
schiena. Non riusciresti a capire chi  anche
se le inviassimo un mail da qui."
Snake schiocc la lingua, frustrato.
Campbell si mise a pensare per un minuto.
"Ci sono: se senti il suono di tasti premuti
su un cellulare,  sicuramente quello di
Jennifer. Cerca di sentire quel suono."
"Il suono dei tasti di un cellulare..."#C0

column2:
Campbell prosegu: "Jennifer sta usando il
cellulare per inviarci messaggi. Se senti un
suono di tasti premuti su un cellulare, voltati
verso l'ostaggio pi vicino e premi il tasto
Azione per parlare con quella persona. Se si
tratta di Jennifer, ti dovrebbe dare una
qualche risposta."
"E se mi sbaglio?"
"Il nemico potrebbe sentire il rumore e
venire a controllare. Non parlare con
nessuno. Non premere il tasto Azione finch

Azione per parlare con quella persona. Se si

senza darti la possibilit di piangere per la
morte di quei poveri innocenti. 1... 2..."
Fatman alzava un dito alla volta mentre
contava.
"... 3... 4... 5! Hai finito? Perch  ora di
morire!"#C0

column2:
Estaba dentro. La infiltracin submarina de
Snake al Big Shell haba sido un xito.
Cuando se mont al ascensor de la parte
inferior del Soporte A, se par para repasar
la misin con Campbell.
Seis horas antes, el Big Shell haba sido
tomado por un grupo de extremistas muy
armados. Los terroristas haban secuestrado
al Presidente, que se encontraba de visita
oficial en el Big Shell, y tambin haban
secuestrado al personal que en ese
momento se encontraba all trabajando.
Pedan un rescate por la liberalizacin de
los rehenes. El rescate que pedan era
absurdo: una lista de 20 trivialidades y ms
30 millones de dlares al contado.
"Los objetivos de tu misin son los
siguientes," haba dicho Campbell.
"Primero, infltrate en la planta de limpieza
del medio ambiente conocida como "Big
Shell" y rescata al Presidente y al resto de
los rehenes. Luego neutraliza a los
terroristas. En esta misin, podrs utilizar
cualquier medio para cumplir tus objetivos,
es decir, el fin justifica los medios.
Tu contacto te proporcionar ms
informacin ms adelante."
"Contacto?"
"Uno de los agentes del Servicio Secreto del
Presidente, un hombre conocido como
Richard Ames, parece que ha conseguido
esquivar a los terroristas."
El nombre le resultaba conocido a Snake.
Lo haba escuchado antes.
"Ames? No es el marido de Nastasha?"
"Ex marido," le corrigi Campbell. "Tambin
fue l quien nos pidi ayuda. Pero parece
ser que el medio de comunicacin que
estaba utilizando ha sido destruido, y no
conseguimos ponernos en contacto con l.
Tendrs que comunicarte con Ames
directamente e intentar averiguar todo lo
que puedas sobre la situacin en el interior.
Su ltima transmisin vino del Soporte F, y
seguramente todava se encuentre
escondido en algn lugar de esa seccin.
se es el primer lugar al que deberas
dirigirte."

El ascensor comenz a subir. Mientras
Snake se quitaba su equipo de buceo,
repas mentalmente las ltimas rdenes que
Campbell le haba dado. Supuestamente
Ames se estaba escondiendo de los
terroristas. Incluso si Snake consegua
acercarse a Ames, ste no saldra de su
escondite si a Snake le estaban siguiendo.
Cuando lleg al Soporte F comenz a
buscar a Ames, teniendo especial cuidado
para no ser descubierto por el enemigo. El
Soporte F se encontraba al noreste del
Soporte A.#C0

column2:
Snake se dirige al hombre.
"T debes de ser Ames."
Ames afirm con la cabeza. "Y t tienes que
ser Solid Snake."
Ames interpret el encogimiento de hombros
de Snake como un s.
"Saba que te enviaran a ti. Despus de
todo, les ped al mejor de sus hombres. Me
impresion mucho tu trabajo hace un par de
aos en ese tanque."
"Te refieres a la matanza de todos y cada
uno de los terroristas?" Sinti el dolor que
todava le causaban los recuerdos de tal
incidente; montones de jvenes soldados
yaciendo muertos en la cubierta, el olor a
sangre que impregnaba cada rincn de
aquel barco...
"Pero conseguiste rescatar a todos los
rehenes, no?" dijo Ames.
Snake haba escuchado estas mismas
palabras en un sin fin de ocasiones, pero no
mitigaban el profundo dolor que senta.
Nunca lo haran. Snake no tena ganas de
explicar el porqu.
"Dnde est el Presidente?" dijo, yendo
directo al grano.
Ames mir hacia otro lado
"Yo... no lo s."
"Y qu me dices del resto de los
rehenes?"
"... No estoy seguro."
"Quiere decir que no sabes nada?"
"He visto al cabecilla de los terroristas."
"A quin? Quin es?"
"Fatman."
Snake intent hacer memoria. No tard
mucho tiempo en recordar ese nombre.
Fatman. Un antiguo miembro de la seccin
SEAL de la Marina, un loco y apasionado de
las bombas. El "Emperador de los
Explosivos". Un hombre sin principios ni
credos. Un insensible criminal que se
vendera incluso al diablo por un buen
precio. Pero no le haban detenido hace ya
tres aos tras la explosin en aquella
iglesia?
"Fue absuelto," escupi Ames con
indignacin, anticipndose a la pregunta de
Snake.
"Pero si murieron ms de 30 personas?"
"El jurado le encontr inocente. Dijeron que
haba "serias dudas" sobre su implicacin en
tal incidente. Fatman tiene un montn de
amigos, peces gordos, que pueden
permitirse contratar a los mejores abogados.
Compr su libertad, y la pag con el dinero
sucio que consigui por matar a esos
pobres inocentes."
La boca de Ames se empez a mover,
pareca que iba a rerse.
"Si entonces se hubiera hecho justicia, esto
no estara ocurriendo... En otras palabras, el
fallo del jurado nos va a costar la vida, y la
vida de nuestro Presidente."
Ames se gir hacia Snake.
"Snake, rescata al Presidente. S que
Fatman estaba en el helipuerto.
Probablemente todava siga all."
"El helipuerto... Est en el tejado
del Soporte E, no?"
Cuando Snake asenta y se levantaba para
marcharse, Ames le detuvo.
"No pierdas tiempo intentando capturarle
con vida. Tiene muchos ases bajo su
manga. Y la vida del Presidente todava
corre peligro."
Ames sac su USP y mir a Snake
directamente a los ojos.
"Promteme que le matars."
Le dio su USP a Snake. Y luego sac unos
objetos ms de su chaqueta.
"Toma, ser mejor que te lleves esto. Los
he cogido cuando vena hacia aqu. Te
vendrn bien cuando te vayas a enfrentar a
Fatman."
Espray refrigerante, un sensor detector de
bombas A y una tarjeta de seguridad del
Nivel 1. Snake cogi los objetos y los puso
junto a los suyos.
"De acuerdo. Yo me ocupar del resto."
"Confo en ti. Creo que por ahora me
quedar aqu."
"Me parece una buena idea."
Snake sali de la habitacin. Al salir,
escuch como Ames cerraba la puerta
detrs de l. Tal y como haba dicho,
planeaba quedarse en esa habitacin. Son
el Codec. Era Campbell.
"Snake, hemos descubierto el lugar en el
que estn siendo retenidos los rehenes."
"Cmo lo habis descubierto?"
"Por correo electrnico. Alguien est
utilizando su mvil para mandar mensajes al
gobierno, una agente del Servicio Secreto
llamada Jennifer."
"Dnde estn los rehenes?"
"Ha dicho que estn en el ncleo del Shell
1, en el nivel B1."
"Yo tambin he descubierto donde est el
cabecilla del grupo terrorista. Cual es mi
prioridad, el cabecilla o los rehenes?"
"T decides, Snake. Buena suerte."#C0

SEAL de la Marina, un loco y apasionado de

Explosivos". Un hombre sin principios ni
credos. Un insensible criminal que se
vendera incluso al diablo por un buen
precio. Pero no le haban detenido hace ya
tres aos tras la explosin en aquella
iglesia?
"Fue absuelto," escupi Ames con
indignacin, anticipndose a la pregunta de
Snake.
"Pero si murieron ms de 30 personas?"
"El jurado le encontr inocente. Dijeron que
haba "serias dudas" sobre su implicacin en
tal incidente. Fatman tiene un montn de
amigos, peces gordos, que pueden
permitirse contratar a los mejores abogados.
Compr su libertad, y la pag con el dinero
sucio que consigui por matar a esos
pobres inocentes."
La boca de Ames se empez a mover,
pareca que iba a rerse.
"Si entonces se hubiera hecho justicia, esto
no estara ocurriendo... En otras palabras, el
fallo del jurado nos va a costar la vida, y la
vida de nuestro Presidente."
Ames se gir hacia Snake.
"Snake, rescata al Presidente. S que
Fatman estaba en el helipuerto.
Probablemente todava siga all."
"El helipuerto... Est en el tejado
del Soporte E, no?"
Cuando Snake asenta y se levantaba para
marcharse, Ames le detuvo.
"No pierdas tiempo intentando capturarle
con vida. Tiene muchos ases bajo su
manga. Y la vida del Presidente todava
corre peligro."
Ames sac su USP y mir a Snake
directamente a los ojos.
"Promteme que le matars."
Le dio su USP a Snake. Y luego sac unos
objetos ms de su chaqueta.
"Toma, ser mejor que te lleves esto. Los
he cogido cuando vena hacia aqu. Te
vendrn bien cuando te vayas a enfrentar a
Fatman."
Espray refrigerante, un sensor detector de
bombas A y una tarjeta de seguridad del
Nivel 1. Snake cogi los objetos y los puso
junto a los suyos.

quedar aqu."

Jennifer brillaron de alegra. Pero ste no
era el momento de corresponder a esa
alegra. Snake le dijo,
"No quiero decepcionarte, pero mi prioridad
es rescatar al Presidente. Tendrs que ser

Los hombros de Jennifer se echaron hacia

"Primero necesito que me digas todo lo que
sabes. Si me entiendes, asiente con la

Jennifer asinti. Snake le quit la mano de

"Bueno, cuando me ataron y me tiraron al
suelo, pens que nunca saldra de aqu con
vida. Luego vino este to a rescatarme, pero
resulta que es un imbcil con mucha sangre
fra, y ahora estoy muy enfadada."
Snake se qued sin palabras. "Yo... no es
lo..."
"Estoy bromeando. Ests buscando al
Presidente, no? l ya se ha ido," dijo
Jennifer con indiferencia. Continu hablando
orgullosa de la admiracin que sus palabras
estaban causando en Snake. "Se escap a
travs de la parte inferior de uno de los
soportes. Seguro que ahora est en un
barco camino de Manhattan. Uno de mis
compaeros consigui sacarle cuando nos
estaban atacando."
"Ests segura?" "S. Sorprendido, eh?"
Jennifer sonri con orgullo. "Una pena que
nos detuvieran antes de que l partiera...
Bueno, y eso es todo. No crees que ahora
me puedes salvar a m?"
Si el Presidente ha conseguido escapar
sano y salvo, rescatar a los rehenes era su
siguiente misin. Snake asinti.
"... De acuerdo. Pero primero me tengo que
ocupar de ese guardia."
Cuando Snake se estaba levantando,
Jennifer le detuvo.
"No me parece una buena idea."
"Por qu no?"
"Porque en teora han colocado una bomba
aqu. Nos dijeron que la activaran si
intentbamos escapar."
Snake lanz un pequeo gruido. Esto no
va a resultar tan fcil.
"... Sabes dnde la han colocado?"
"Por lo que s, debe de estar en algn lugar
del ncleo del Shell 1."
"Vale. Antes de nada, me voy a ocupar de
esa bomba."
Y justo entonces, escucharon a uno de los
terroristas hablar, por radio, con uno de sus
camaradas. Planeaban aumentar las
medidas de seguridad en la habitacin en la
que estaban los rehenes. Tena que salir de
all rpidamente.
"Parece que los terroristas no tienen
ninguna intencin de herir a los rehenes, al
menos por ahora. As que sigue haciendo
como que ests atada durante un rato ms,
vale?"
"Vale. Tengo una tarjeta de nivel de
seguridad 2 escondida en mi chaqueta.
Venga, cgela."
Mientras Snake cacheaba la chaqueta en
bsqueda de la tarjeta, Jennifer solt un
chillido.
"Eh, cuidado donde tocas chaval!... eso es,
un poco ms abajo... ah, ah est."
Mientras Snake coga la tarjeta de nivel de
seguridad 2, Jennifer le dijo mirndole
fijamente a los ojos.
"Vuelve pronto, vale?"
"No te preocupes, lo har."
Snake volvi a colocar la venda en los ojos
de Jennifer, y luego sali de la sala de
reuniones.#C0

"Buen trabajo," dijo Campbell. "Y ahora

column2:
Fatman cay desplomado al suelo
produciendo un gran estruendo. Un ro de

|
Snake llam a Campbell por el Codec y le
dijo lo que haba ocurrido. Campbell le
comunic que el Presidente se encontraba
sano y salvo bajo la custodia del Guardia
Costero. Y lo que es ms, los SEALS
haban entrado a la planta mientras Snake
estaba luchando contra Fatman y estaban
liquidando al resto de los terroristas.
Pero haba algo que no cuadraba. Fatman le
haba dicho que Ames fue la persona que
secuestr al Presidente. No creo que l
estuviera mintiendo. Y si fuera as, entonces
por qu Ames le pidi ayuda...?
|
De repente, Snake escuch la voz de una
mujer.
Era Jennifer. Los SEALS la haban
rescatado, dijo ella. El resto de los rehenes
tambin estaban a salvo. Pero estaba
decepcionada porque Snake no la haba
rescatado personalmente. Le pregunt si
estaba contento ahora que la misin ya se
haba terminado. "S, pero hay algo que
todava me tiene algo intrigado," respondi
Snake. "Hay algo... que no cuadra."
"Qu es lo que no cuadra?"
"Fatman dijo que Ames estaba trabajando
con los terroristas. Pero l..."
Jennifer abri los ojos como platos. "Eso
es imposible! Si fue Richard quien ayud a
escapar al Presidente."
"De qu ests hablando?"
Estaba ocurriendo algo raro. Creo que
Fatman estaba diciendo la verdad. Pero
tambin era verdad que Ames cooper con
Snake. Y ahora Jennifer estaba diciendo
que Ames fue quien ayud a rescatar al
Presidente. E incluso si Fatman estaba
mintiendo, si lo que Jennifer deca era
verdad, por qu Ames no le haba dicho
que ya haba rescatado al Presidente?
Snake reflexionaba sobre todo esto para
sus adentros. A Jennifer no le gustaba que
l no compartiera sus inquietudes con ella.
"No s lo que ests pensando, pero te
puedo asegurar de que Richard es uno de
nuestros mejores agentes. Es imposible que
estuviera trabajando con los terroristas."
".. Y por qu es imposible?"
"Porque su hermana muri en un incidente
terrorista, vctima de una bomba. Hace tres
aos..."
Un escalofro recorri la espina dorsal de
Snake. Las palabras iban encajando una a
una. Hace tres aos... una bomba
terrorista... hermana... iglesia... Fatman.
Snake record repentinamente el extrao
comportamiento de Ames. Su rabia al hablar
sobre la absolucin de Fatman. Y su
convencimiento al hablar sobre el fallo
del jurado. La expresin de sus ojos cuando
le dio la pistola a Snake y le dijo,
"Promteme que le matars..."
Ahora las cosas iban cobrando sentido.
Fatman mat a la hermana de Ames y no
pag por su delito. Ames prometi
vengarse. Plane cautelosamente su
venganza. Se acerc al grupo extremista y
les propuso secuestrar al Presidente.
Contrat a Fatman para que realizara el
trabajo. Dirigi a los terroristas. Ayud al
Presidente a escapar, pero no se lo
comunic a las autoridades. Finalmente,
pidi la ayuda de Solid Snake, el clebre
antiterrorista, para que interviniera
personalmente. El Big Shell era el lugar en
el que aconteca su plan. Y el Presidente
era el cebo para que Fatman picara. Y
Snake, l mismo, sera el verdugo.
"Dnde est Ames?! Le has visto?!"
Jennifer pareca sorprendida por el cambio
de actitud de Snake. "No. Pero
probablemente todava sigue escondido en
algn lugar. En realidad es muy tmido y
miedoso, sabes? Pero estoy segura de
que saldr de su escondite cuando sepa
que los terroristas han sido capturados..."
No va a salir, pens Snake para sus
adentros.
Ms tarde, busc a Ames, pero no haba
ningn rastro de l en todo el pas, como
para encontrarle en el Big Shell. Haba
desaparecido.#C0

|
"Por qu no le has matado?"
Snake se dio la vuelta y vio que Ames

"Por qu? Te debera hacer la misma

"Qu?"
"Fatman me lo cont todo. T tenas que
vigilar al Presidente."
Ames se ri.
"Fatman? Y le crees a Fatman..."
Snake no parpade.
"S, le creo... T y Fatman trabajabais

"No."
"Seguro?"
Snake avanz hacia Ames. La mano de

Jennifer que se aproxim repentinamente

"Por que fue Richard quien ayud al

claro es que nunca participara con un grupo

Despus de todo, su hermana..."
"Jennifer!" le interrumpi Ames. Ella le

"Richard perdi a su hermana pequea en
un ataque terrorista, tras la explosin de

Y su convencimiento al hablar sobre el fallo

Tena una hiptesis.
Snake mir a Ames. Su cara no mostraba

una realidad...
"Ames, no me dijiste que el Presidente ya
haba sido rescatado porque pensabas que
si lo hacas, sera menos probable que yo

Ames no contest. Snake continu.
"Nos llamaste a nosotros en vez de llamar
a la polica, porque creas que sera ms
probable que nosotros matramos a Fatman
en vez de capturarle vivo?"
"Ya es suficiente!" grit Jennifer. Ames se
acerc su mano todava ms a su pecho.
"... Tu plan, en todo momento, era que yo
matara a Fatman, no? Y todo esto era
slo..."
Ames sac de pronto una pistola del bolsillo
de su chaqueta. Snake reaccion
inmediatamente, y se escondi detrs de
una caja que haba cerca. Pero Ames
estaba apuntando directamente al cuerpo

"Para!"
Jennifer le dio un golpe en la mano a Ames
y ste perdi el control de la pistola. Sali

que l. Se estir y cogi la pistola antes de

"... Dime que no es verdad..."
Ames asinti con la cabeza muy despacio.
"As que... es verdad?"

"S..."

Tras la muerte de su hermana, y la

Fatman y para que le convenciera de que

haba imaginado. Segn el plan de Ames,

Snake tena que asesinarlo. Y todo para

Jennifer se agach para estar al lado de

Snake, cada vez ms enfadado. "Parece
que mi plan perfecto ha fracasado. Me voy
de aqu antes de que sea demasiado tarde.
Pero antes, me voy a ocupar de ti!" Los
patines de Fatman se empezaron a mover.#C0

column2:
"Snake, I have a favor to ask," said 
Otacon.
Snake's face creased into a frown. 
Otacon's "favors" always meant trouble, 
usually for Snake.
"Forget it. I don't know what you're up 
to this time, but I'm through running 
around the country on some half-baked 
crusade I don't even understand."
"It's nothing like that. It's... it's my 
sister."
"Your sister?"
"Yeah. Her name's Emma." Otacon's 
voice suddenly became grave as he 
began to relate his story. He'd recently 
discovered the whereabouts of his 
long-estranged stepsister. Apparently, 
she was working as a systems 
programmer at an ocean cleanup facility 
in Manhattan Bay called "Big Shell."
"Wait a minute. Big Shell... isn't that
where...?"
"Exactly. So you've heard the rumors, 
too."
There had recently been a string of 
accidental deaths among the employees 
of Big Shell. A number of rumors were 
circulating about the cause of these 
deaths - there was a serial killer on the 
loose, the employees were going 
stir-crazy, the whole place was haunted. 
Big Shell had gone from being a 
symbol of environmental responsibility 
to being a lucrative source of tabloid 
gossip.
"I'm worried about Emma. Will you go 
and check on her for me?"
Snake waved his hand in dismissal. 
"Go ask the police or something."
"You know they wouldn't do anything 
about it."
"And you assumed that I would?"
"I've got a bad feeling about this thing. 
Just go and check for me, please?"
"You go."
"Come on!"
"No way!"
"I'm telling you, Snake, I've got a 
REALLY bad feeling about this! Please, 
I'm begging you!"
"Leave me alone!"
|
Six hours later, Snake found himself 
standing on the heliport of Big Shell. 
He watched as a group of armed men 
began to take over the facility before 
his eyes. Snake hid himself behind a 
crate. Just then, Otacon called on the 
Codec.
"...You think they're some kind of 
terrorists?" he asked.
"I dunno. But it's pretty clear that 
the situation is a little more dangerous 
than before. Congratulations. Looks like 
you guessed right."
"That's not exactly reassuring. I hope 
Emma's still okay...."
"Yeah, me too," said Snake. His eye 
drifted over to a Harrier jet parked on 
the heliport. "What about that Harrier? 
Does it belong to them?"
"No, that belongs to the Marines. 
Apparently they made an emergency 
landing here three days ago, after a 
problem occurred during a training 
exercise."
Snake nodded. "First things first. We'd 
better find out what exactly is going on 
here. I'm going in."
"Roger. Be careful in there. Oh, and 
Snake..."
"What?"
"If you do happen to meet Emma, don't 
mention my name, okay?"
"Why not?"
"Well... we haven't seen each other in a 
long time... and it's all kind of sudden..."
Otacon hesitated. Snake realized that 
there was more to the situation than 
Otacon was willing to let on. He decided 
to let it drop as he headed inside Big 
Shell.#C0

column2:
Snake emerged onto the DE connecting 
bridge. Sensing a presence nearby, 
he quickly hid himself in the shadows. 
Soon he heard the sound of footsteps, 
accompanied by voices.
"What about that girl who got away?" 
said a man's voice.
"We lost her in Strut C," said another 
man.
Girl? Were they talking about Emma? 
Snake cocked his head to listen more 
closely.
"Lost her? Ooh, that's not good," said 
the first man.
"Why?"
"Well, I don't know all the details, but I 
heard that we need that brat to get it 
back. So until we get our hands on her, 
we're screwed."
Snake stole a peek at the two men. 
They were decked out in full military 
gear, but they didn't seem to carry 
themselves like soldiers.
The first man continued.#C0

column2:
Snake slowly approached the girl, who 
shrank into the corner of the food 
storage locker.
"You're Emma, right?"
"Who are you? How do you know 
my name?!"
"Calm down," said Snake, trying to 
reassure her. "I'm on your side. I came 
to rescue you!"
"You're... on my side?"
"That's right."
"You came to save me?"
"Yes."
"...Really?"
"Really."
Emma regarded Snake with a suspicious 
look.
"...Do I really look like I can't be 
trusted?" said Snake.
"What's the matter, don't you have a 
mirror in your house?"
Snake started to protest, but Emma cut 
him off.
"Whatever. So, why exactly did you 
come to rescue me?"
Snake recalled what Otacon had said to 
him -- whatever happens, don't mention 
his name.
"I can't tell you that."
"Why not?"
"Because, I just can't."
Emma looked Snake up and down, from 
head to toe. She didn't exactly look 
convinced, but she seemed to let her 
guard down.
"...You know, for a hero, you don't 
sound very convincing. But I guess you 
don't seem like such a bad guy, either. 
What's your name?"
"Solid Snake."
Suddenly, Emma stood up and grabbed 
Snake by the ear.
"Hel-LO? Habla Ingles? I asked you 
what your NAME was, not what your 
NICKNAME was. God, what a freak!" 
Emma released Snake's ear and looked 
him square in the eye. "What's -- your 
-- REAL -- name?"
"I got rid of it."
"Huh?"
"People in my line of work don't need 
names."
A slight frown crossed Emma's face. 
"...Hmph. You might not be a bad guy, 
but you sure are weird. But whatever. 
So... Solid?"
"Call me Snake." Snake sighed. Talking 
to this kid was making him tired.
"Man, you're really uptight about names, 
aren't you? Okay then, SNAKE, 
you're..."
Snake interrupted her. "Let me ask you 
a few questions, all right?"
"...Sure, fine."
"Why are those terrorists looking for 
you?"
"Maybe it's because they find me 
irresistibly attractive."
Snake couldn't think of anything to say 
to this. Emma seemed a little 
disappointed.
"...Or maybe it's because I changed the 
password for the computer system and 
locked them out."
"What do you mean?"
Emma explained. She'd seen the 
terrorists trying to use Big Shell's 
computer system to do something. 
Then, after creating a diversion and 
making her escape, she'd made a 
change to the system so that they 
couldn't use it anymore. "It bought me 
some time, and I thought it might irritate 
them as an added bonus, too."
She was probably more concerned with 
the latter, Snake thought to himself. 
"So what are the terrorists trying to do 
with the system?"
"How should I know?"
"Does it have something to do with the 
'ghost of Big Shell'?"
"What are you talking about?" Emma 
feigned a look of surprise.
"They said that some of their comrades 
got killed by the 'ghost of Big Shell.' 
So who is this 'ghost' they're talking 
about, anyway?"
Emma glared at Snake in disgust.
"Why are you looking at me like that?"
"The 'ghost of Big Shell'? That's so 
lame!" She waved her hands above her 
head. "Sure, it's true that three of them 
have died in the last month. It was 
actually really sad. Two of them just up 
and disappeared one after another. 
Then this other guy who'd just got here, 
he disappeared, too.... But they were all 
accidents, okay? They're just 
connecting it with some stupid, childish 
legend...."
"'Legend'? So this 'ghost' story has 
been around for a while?"
"Yeah. They say that there was this one 
employee a long time ago whose son 
died, and he tried to kill himself, but he 
didn't really die, he just got really 
mangled and stuff, and now he haunts 
the place.... You know, that sort of 
thing."
Something in Emma's eyes seemed to 
flicker for a moment, but she quickly 
recovered. Her voice became cheerful 
again.
"Hey, these kinds of places always have 
one or two ghost stories associated with 
them, right?... Some people say they've 
seen shadows lurking around in 
supposedly empty rooms, but personally 
I think someone's probably just slacking 
off on the job."
"But..."
"There's no such thing as ghosts!" 
Emma was clearly getting flustered.
"Okay, settle down. I don't believe in 
ghost stories, either."
"I know! Stupid, aren't they?" Emma 
looked relieved.
"Right. But I don't want to rule out any 
possibilities. Do you think anyone could 
have gotten in here without 
authorization?"
Emma thought for a minute. "...Big Shell 
is almost completely automated, so 
most of it's inaccessible to people. 
But yeah, I guess it might be possible. 
Still..."
Suddenly, the door to the Dining Hall 
burst open. Enemy guards started 
pouring into the room, shouting angrily. 
It looked like their conversation had 
dragged on a little bit too long. Snake 
grunted in frustration. It was tough to 
concentrate with Emma around.
"Emma! Get down!" Snake yelled as 
he drew his USP.#C0

column2:
The guards all lay silent on the floor. 
Snake put away his gun and moved 
towards Emma, who was cowering in 
the corner again. He put his hand on 
her shoulder.
"Emma, are you all right?"
"Yeah..." Emma hung her head, trying 
to avoid Snake's gaze.
"Emma?"
"...I know I've only known you for 10 
minutes, but I've already learned 
something about you."
"What's that?"
"You're just like them. You're good at 
killing people." She was trying to put a 
strong face on, but her voice was 
wavering.
"In my world," said Snake, "there's only 
one law: kill or be killed. That's what's 
kept me alive so far. And that's the only 
thing that's keeping you alive right now. 
If you want to survive, you'd better 
learn to be strong."
Emma raised her head. "...I just learned 
something else about you. You're also 
good at justifying yourself, aren't you?"
Emma drew closer to Snake.
His face was covered with the blood of 
others. It was a face exhausted by 
battle.#C0

column2:
"It's nothing. Forget about it," said 
Snake. "Now let's get back to the task 
at hand. Where are the other 
hostages?"
"They're all on the first floor of the Shell 
2 Core. I don't think anybody's been 
hurt yet, but still..."
"Don't worry. I'll do everything I can to 
help them. You'd better stay here...."
"Wait! You can't get to the Shell 2 
Core!"
"What?"
"I locked the door in Strut D that links 
the Shell 1 and Shell 2 Cores. It won't 
open, even with a card."
"So how do I open it, then?"
"You've got to access the node in Strut 
B and enter the password." She dictated 
a 16-character string of letters and 
numbers to him.
Snake nodded. "Got it."
Emma looked surprised. "Shouldn't you 
write it down or something?"
"In my line of work, we don't take 
notes." 
Snake demonstrated by reciting the 
password from memory.
"So you're good at memorizing things, 
too, huh?"
"I'm heading for Strut B. You stay put."
"But..."
"No buts. Just leave everything to me. 
I'm good at running errands, too."
Emma smiled. "Okay. Here, take this 
with you. It's an extra security card. 
You'll need it to get into Strut B. I've 
got my own card with me, so it's okay."
Snake took the card from Emma. "I'll be 
back before you know it. No matter 
what happens, don't open the door. And 
try not to make a sound."
Emma nodded and closed the door to 
the locker.#C0

column2:
Snake accessed the node. He entered 
the password that Emma had given him. 
After a moment, the monitor displayed 
a message saying that the lock on the 
door to the Shell 1 - 2 connecting bridge 
had been released. Snake turned to 
head back to Strut C, he heard a voice 
emanating from an unseen speaker. It 
sounded like some kind of building-wide 
announcement.
"This is a message for the 'ghost of Big
Shell'. You are hereby ordered to 
remove the lock on the system using the
control key you got from the girl at 
once. You have fifteen minutes to 
comply. If you fail to do so, we will kill 
the girl. I repeat..."
The voice repeated its warning. A chill 
ran up his spine. The girl they were 
talking about had to be Emma. Had 
they really gotten their hands on her? 
And what was this control key they 
were talking about? Snake called Otacon 
via the Codec.
"They got Emma?!" Otacon exploded. 
"What did you..."
"Just calm down for a minute. I'm trying 
to think of a way to save her."
The calm returned to Otacon's voice. 
"All right."
"This control key that they're talking 
about, could it be this card that Emma 
gave me?"
"No, that's just a security card. It's 
only good for opening doors. The 
control key is just what it sounds like -- 
an actual key that only Big Shell's 
system administrator would have access 
to. It acts as a verification device. 
Basically, you can't make any changes 
to Big Shell's computer system without 
it. The terrorists need it to release the 
lock on the system...."
"What if they used a password like I 
just did?"
"That wouldn't work. Passwords are 
only good up to security level 3. Beyond 
that, you'd need the control key to gain 
access...."
"Sounds like you've been doing your 
homework."
"Snake, are you sure Emma didn't give 
you anything else?"
"Yeah. What makes them think I have 
it, anyway?"
"...Maybe Emma lied to them."
"Or maybe she gave it to the real 'ghost 
of Big Shell.'"
"That's not possible," said Otacon 
quickly.
"And how can you be so sure?" 
countered Snake.
"Hey, you said yourself that there's no 
such thing, didn't you? We have to 
hurry and save Emma!"
"You're right. But we don't even know 
where they've taken her...."
Over the Codec, Snake heard the sound 
of Otacon smacking one hand against 
the other.
"That's it! Why didn't I think of it 
before?"
"What?"
"Emma said she had her own card with 
her, right? Security cards in Big Shell 
work on an RFID system -- that's radio 
frequency identification. Each RFID 
card is imbedded with an IC chip that 
sends data via a radio signal. The card 
readers can use these signals to detect 
any IDs within range. All data in Big 
Shell is managed by an integrated 
management system. And that system 
is accessible with a level 3 password!" 
Otacon was speaking rapidly now.
"...Meaning?" said Snake.
"Meaning that you can use the node to 
find out which strut Emma is in! Snake, 
try accessing the node again using that 
password."
Snake did as Otacon said. After a 
moment, the screen displayed a blinking 
light in Strut F.
"That's her. She's in Strut F. Snake, 
you've got to hurry!"#C0
column3:

the password that Emma had given him. 
After a moment, the monitor displayed 
a message saying that the lock on the 
door to the Shell 1 - 2 connecting bridge 
had been released. Snake turned to 
head back to Strut C, he heard a voice 
emanating from an unseen speaker. It 
sounded like some kind of building-wide 
announcement.
"This is a message for the 'ghost of Big
Shell'. You are hereby ordered to 
remove the lock on the system using the
control key you got from the girl at 
once. You have fifteen minutes to 
comply. If you fail to do so, we will kill 
the girl. I repeat..."
The voice repeated its warning. A chill 
ran up his spine. The girl they were 
talking about had to be Emma. Had 
they really gotten their hands on her? 
And what was this control key they 
were talking about? Snake called Otacon 
via the Codec.
"They got Emma?!" Otacon exploded. 
"What did you..."
"Just calm down for a minute. I'm trying 
to think of a way to save her."
The calm returned to Otacon's voice. 
"All right."
"This control key that they're talking 
about, could it be this card that Emma 
gave me?"

only good for opening doors. The 
control key is just what it sounds like --

connecting bridge, he got a call on 
the Codec."This is Snake."
"Don't give me that 'this is Snake' 
routine!" Otacon was furious. "Where 
do you think you're going, anyway? 
Emma is in Strut F! Get over there 
now!"#C0

column2:
Snake passed through the door to Strut 
F. Emma was being held captive 
somewhere in this part of the facility. 
He'd have to be extra cautious from 
here on out. If the enemy spotted him, 
they'd kill Emma without hesitation. 
Snake would have to find her without 
being detected.#C0

column2:
Snake had found Emma.
"Emma!"
Emma looked up without rising from 
her crouched position. "You're late!" 
She had a sullen look on her face, but 
she didn't appear to be hurt.
"Sorry. It took me a while to find the 
control key."
Emma stuck out her tongue at Snake's 
sarcasm. "Oh, that.... You have to admit 
it did buy us some time, didn't it?"
She showed no sign of remorse. 
Just as Otacon had guessed, Emma 
had indeed lied to the terrorists.
"What in the world made you do a thing 
like that? If you'd made one false 
move..."
"Hey, I just didn't want them to get 
away with it, that's all. And... I believed 
in you."
"Believed what?"
"That you'd come and rescue me, of 
course."
Snake shook his head. "That's not the 
point. The point is, you shouldn't be 
putting yourself in so much danger...."
"I know. But listen, you're never gonna 
believe this! I found out what the 
terrorists are looking for!"
"What is it?"
"Drugs!"
Emma related a story she'd heard from 
one of the guards while she was being 
held captive.
The armed group that had taken over 
Big Shell belonged to a Russian crime 
syndicate. With the collaboration of a 
number of employees in the facility, the 
syndicate was using Big Shell as a 
waypoint in their drug smuggle 
operations. At night they'd sneak the 
drugs from smuggling ships out at sea 
into Big Shell using small boats. Then 
they'd slip the drugs in with the 
outgoing cargo from Big Shell and get 
them into the country that way. Security 
in the harbor had been getting tighter in 
recent years, and this was a convenient 
and effective way of getting the goods 
through without being exposed.
One month earlier, they'd brought in a 
600 kg shipment of drugs with a street 
value of over $7 million. The following 
day, two of the employees who were 
working with the syndicate were killed 
in two consecutive accidents. The 
syndicate immediately sent one of their 
men in to investigate, but he too was 
killed in an accident shortly after 
arriving.
The leaders of the syndicate decided 
that these incidents were the work of a 
rival syndicate that had been competing 
with them in the drug trade and that 
were now trying to seize their shipment. 
They'd sent in their troops in to recover
the drugs, leading to the current 
situation. 
"So the 'ghost of Big Shell' is..."
A mischievous grin spread across 
Emma's face. "Exactly. It's not a ghost 
at all. It's just a plain old hitman who's 
been sent by the rival syndicate to 
steal the drugs."
"...And you told them that I'm the 
hitman."
"Well... yeah, but what's done is done, 
right? No use arguing about it."
Snake decided not to pursue the matter 
any further. He changed the subject. 
"So where could they be hiding such a 
huge amount of drugs in Big Shell?"
"I have no clue. I didn't have any idea 
what was going on. I'm still having 
trouble believing it even now...."
Snake, too, was puzzled. How could it 
be possible for a few employees to 
keep hundreds of kilograms of drugs 
hidden in Big Shell without the others 
finding out? He couldn't afford to waste 
any more time thinking about it, though. 
The hostages' lives were still in danger.
"The hostages are still in the Shell 2 
Core, aren't they?"
"Yeah...." Emma tried to get up and 
stumbled. She slowly staggered to her 
feet.
"Are you all right?" Snake asked.
"Yeah, I'm fine.... Actually, the 
terrorists injected me with something. 
They said it was to keep me from 
running away again. I think it was some 
kind of tranquilizer.... Now my feet feel 
like they weigh about a ton each...."
Emma started to lose her balance 
again. Snake caught her as she fell. 
Even in her incapacitated state, she'd 
managed to extract information from the 
enemy, and never lost sight of her 
purpose for being there. This girl was 
full of surprises. In that respect, at 
least, she resembled her stepbrother.
"That's enough. You'd better go hide 
somewhere."
"No way. I'm coming with you."
"But..."
"Please, take me with you." Emma's 
eyes leveled with Snake's.
"You've saved my life twice now. I want 
to return the favor if I can. I know 
I'll come in handy somehow.... Please!"
Snake gave in at last. To get to the 
Shell 1 Core, he'd have to cross the 
Shell 1 - 2 connecting bridge from 
Strut D. The two set out for Strut D.#C0

column2:
Snake and Emma arrived at Strut E. 
Emma's eyes were drawn to a nearby 
conveyor belt.
"I've got it!" she exclaimed.
"Got what?"
"I know where they hid the drugs." 
Emma went over to the node and 
immediately began punching in 
commands.
"How do you..."
"Just wait and see."
A second later, the conveyor belt spat 
out a crate. Emma opened it. It was 
packed tightly with plastic bags full of 
white powder.
"The syndicate guys knew that no 
matter how good the hiding spot, 
someone was sure to find the drugs if 
they hid them in just one place," 
said Emma as they watched more and 
more crates arrive via the conveyor 
belt. "So they hid the drugs in these 
crates and set them up so they'd just 
go around and around Big Shell without 
actually coming out anywhere."
Snake couldn't help but admire the 
girl's brilliance. He watched as Emma 
took out her PDA and connected it to 
the node.
"Now what are you doing?" he said.
"Hmm. I think I might have found 
something interesting here.... this must 
be..."
Just then, a figure emerged from 
behind the conveyor belt. It was one of 
the terrorists. As soon as he spotted 
Snake and Emma standing there, he 
ran away. Snake moved to pursue the 
escaping terrorist, but Emma grabbed 
his hand.
"Wait!"
"Let go! He's going to go call his 
friends!"
"I know that! Just wait one more 
minute!" Emma began to punch 
commands into the node with incredible 
speed.
"What the hell are you up to now?"
"If we run now, they'll just come after 
us. So..."
Within seconds, Snake could hear the 
sounds of a crowd beginning to gather 
outside the door. Footsteps, voices 
barking orders, rifles being cocked. 
They'd come crashing into the room 
any minute now. Emma, however, 
remained glued to the screen of the 
node.
"Emma!" yelled Snake.
She finally detached herself from the 
node. "There, that should do it. Okay, 
then, let's get going!"
The door burst open. #C0

column2:
Leaving Emma behind, Snake escaped 
to the DE connecting bridge. The door 
of Strut E closed behind him. He let out 
a sigh of relief. Moments later, the 
sound of several gunshots rang out 
behind him. Snake whirled around. The 
sound of Emma's screams pierced his 
ears.#C0

column2:
Somehow, the two managed to escape 
from Strut E onto the DE connecting 
bridge. Snake turned back towards 
Strut E, keeping an eye on their rear. 
The terrorists would be coming after 
them any moment now. He slapped a 
new cartridge into the chamber of his 
gun and shouted at Emma, urging her 
to move quickly towards Strut D. She 
responded with a nonchalant look.
"There's no need to be in such a hurry, 
you know," she said.
They waited a while, but the door to 
Strut E remained shut. From the other 
side, they could hear a tumult as the 
soldiers bashed in vain against the tightly
sealed door. Snake turned to Emma.
"What did you do?"
"I programmed the node to seal off all 
the doors to Strut E once we were out 
safely. Those guys aren't going 
anywhere." Emma looked extremely 
proud of herself. It seemed she'd 
picked up a thing or two from her 
experience with Snake in Strut C.
They entered Strut D. Snake looked 
around for signs of the enemy, but 
there was no one in sight. The 
terrorists must have sent the bulk of 
their forces to Strut E. If that were 
true, then the rest of the struts would 
be nearly deserted. Rescuing the 
hostages would be a breeze.
Snake and Emma passed through Strut 
D and emerged onto the Shell 1 - 2 
connecting bridge. Here, too, the 
enemy was nowhere to be seen. Emma 
smiled her characteristic smile.
"See, no problems at all. Didn't I say 
I'd come in handy?"
"I have to admit, you were pretty good 
back there," Snake said with a nod. He 
recalled the way Emma had connected 
to the node using her PDA. "By the 
way, weren't you downloading 
something back there?"
"Yeah. Was it that obvious?" Emma 
took out her PDA. "When I was 
activating the conveyor belt, I found a 
suspicious-looking hidden file next to 
the conveyor belt control file. I decided 
to download it, and this is what I 
found...."
The screen of her PDA displayed the 
file. It appeared to be some kind of note
from one of the two employees who'd 
been killed in the accidents -- the same 
ones who were helping the syndicate 
smuggle drugs into Big Shell. In it, he 
explained that he was only cooperating 
with the Russians because his wife and 
child were being held hostage. But last 
year, he found out that they'd already 
been killed while trying to escape. He 
fell into a deep despair, and at one 
point he even thought of killing himself. 
But then he had a vision. It was still too 
early for him to die. No, he had to get 
his revenge on the syndicate first. 
Indeed, he'd make them pay in blood 
for what they did to his wife and child.
Over the course of the next year, he 
devised an ingenious plan. He'd make it 
look like he was killed by a rival 
syndicate that was trying to steal the 
drugs. This would start a war between 
the two syndicates that would end up 
destroying both. First, he faked his own 
disappearance. Shortly afterward, 
he used a crane to crush the man the 
syndicate had sent to watch him. 
When the Mafia sent a man to 
investigate both incidents, he threw him 
into the ocean. 
Just as he'd expected, a war erupted 
between the two rival syndicates. With 
everything in place, he could finally rest 
in peace. He said he was going to join 
his wife and child. 
Finally, he implored the person reading 
the memo to say a prayer for his 
departed wife and child. The file 
ended there. It was dated three days 
ago.
Snake looked up from the PDA. 
"...I guess this means the 'ghost of Big 
Shell' is dead?"
Emma was unable to hide her shock. 
"I... I guess so.... Actually, I 
downloaded one more file...."
Snake's ears picked up a faint sound of 
something flying through the air. 
Instantly, he grabbed Emma and held 
her tight. There was an explosion. The 
force of the blast knocked Snake and 
Emma off their feet.
"What was that?" Emma groaned in 
Snake's arms.
A thunderous gale of wind beat against 
their cheeks. Hovering over the bridge, 
beyond the wavering heat from the 
blast, was the Harrier.
"Oh yeah, I guess there WAS 
something that could get out of Strut 
E...." Emma muttered, a look of blank 
amazement on her face. The Harrier 
strafed the bridge with waves of 
machine-gun fire. Snake and Emma 
fled back to the entrance to Strut D.
"Now what do we do?"
"I guess we'll just have to kill it."
"How?"
"I'll think of something."
"Are you serious?!" Emma began to 
protest, but before she could finish, 
Snake thrust her through the door of 
Strut D.
"What are you doing?" she demanded.
"Stay there! No matter what happens, 
don't come out here!"
"But!"
"Just listen to me for once, okay?" 
Snake smiled at her. "I already 
promised someone I'd bring you back 
with me."
"Wha-"
The door slammed shut.
Snake heard the sound of a helicopter 
approaching. It was Otacon in his 
Kasatka.
"Snake, use this!"
Otacon tossed down a box from the 
cockpit. Stinger missiles. With these, 
it became somewhat of an even fight. 
Snake turned and prepared to face the 
Harrier in battle.#C0

devised an ingenious plan. He'd make it 
look like he was killed by a rival 
syndicate that was trying to steal the 
drugs. This would start a war between 
the two syndicates that would end up 
destroying both. First, he faked his own 
disappearance. Shortly afterward, 
he used a crane to crush the man the 
syndicate had sent to watch him. 
When the Mafia sent a man to 
investigate both incidents, he threw him 
into the ocean. 
Just as he'd expected, a war erupted 
between the two rival syndicates. With 
everything in place, he could finally rest 
in peace. He said he was going to join 
his wife and child. 
Finally, he implored the person reading 
the memo to say a prayer for his 
departed wife and child. The file 
ended there. It was dated three days 
ago.
Snake looked up from the PDA. 
"...I guess this means the 'ghost of Big 
Shell' is dead?"
Emma was unable to hide her shock. 
"I... I guess so.... Actually, I 
downloaded one more file...."
Snake's ears picked up a faint sound of 
something flying through the air. 
Instantly, he grabbed Emma and held 
her tight. There was an explosion. The 
force of the blast knocked Snake and 
Emma off their feet.
"What was that?" Emma groaned in 
Snake's arms.
A thunderous gale of wind beat against 
their cheeks. Hovering over the bridge, 
beyond the wavering heat from the 
blast, was the Harrier.
"Oh yeah, I guess there WAS 
something that could get out of Strut 
E...." Emma muttered, a look of blank 
amazement on her face. The Harrier 
strafed the bridge with waves of 
machine-gun fire. Snake and Emma 
fled back to the entrance to Strut D.
"Now what do we do?"
"I guess we'll just have to kill it."
"How?"
"I'll think of something."
"Are you serious?!" Emma began to 
protest, but before she could finish, 
Snake thrust her through the door of 
Strut D.
"What are you doing?" she demanded.
"Stay there! No matter what happens, 
don't come out here!"
"But!"
"Just listen to me for once, okay?" 
Snake smiled at her. "I already 
promised someone I'd bring you back 
with me."
"Wha-"
The door slammed shut.
Snake heard the sound of a helicopter 
approaching. It was Otacon in his 
Kasatka.
"Snake, use this!"
Otacon tossed down a box from the 
cockpit. Stinger missiles. With these, 
it became somewhat of an even fight. 
Snake turned and prepared to face the 
Harrier in battle.#C0

column2:
The Harrier lost control and crashed 
into the bottom of Shell 1. As Snake 
watched it plummet to the earth, the 
door to Strut D opened. Emma peeked 
out cautiously. She looked as if she'd 
been crying.
"It's over."
"What took you so long?"
"Sorry."
"Are you okay? You're not hurt or 
anything?"
"I'm fine, really."
Snake and Emma freed the Big Shell 
employees who had been taken hostage 
and used Big Shell's radio to contact 
the police. The cops would no doubt be 
arriving soon. The terrorists were still 
trapped in Strut E. Snake and Emma 
decided to go to the heliport on Strut I 
to wait for reinforcements to arrive.
"By the way, Emma, weren't you saying 
something about a second file earlier?"
"Oh, right. I managed to dig up the 
personal folders of the guys who were 
working with the syndicate. The first 
guy who died, the guy who wrote the 
memo, had a password-encrypted file 
in his folder. I downloaded it, and..." 
Emma pulled something up on her PDA.#C0

column2:
"Huh?" Emma tilted her head to one 
side.
"What's wrong?"
"It's not coming up...."
The memory IC that was storing the file 
had been shot and damaged. She tried 
to download the file onto another IC, 
but it was no use. The server that the 
file was on had been damaged, she 
said. The data room in the Shell 1 Core 
must have been hit by the shock of the 
Harrier's crash.#C0

column2:
Snake heard the sound of a helicopter 
approaching.
Emma gazed up at the sky. "Is that the 
police?"
The Kasatka came into view. Upon 
seeing its dark shadow, Emma tilted 
her head to one side, puzzled. "That's 
not the police. Who is that?"
Snake looked up at the Kasatka. 
"That's my ride."
Otacon's face peered out of the 
cockpit. Snake could detect fear and 
apprehension in his eyes, but there 
was something else, as well -- a kind 
of grim determination.
"And I think he's got room for you, too."
"Me?"
"You'll understand soon enough."
The Kasatka began to descend. The 
wind from its rotors beat fiercely upon 
their faces. Emma brushed her hair 
back from her cheeks. As the helicopter 
drew closer, Emma recognized the 
figure in the pilot's seat. She gasped. 
Her eyes remained frozen. She stood 
perfectly still, as if rooted in place. 
Tears began to roll down her cheeks. 
The Kasatka touched down at last. 
Without even waiting for the rotors to 
stop spinning, Emma rushed to meet 
her long-lost brother.#C0

column2:
A file appeared on the PDA's LCD 
screen.
It was a report addressed to the 
syndicate concerning their drug 
smuggling activities. Judging by its 
appearance, it was still just a draft copy 
and probably hadn't been sent yet. 
Nevertheless, it contained a wealth of 
information related to the syndicate's 
drug operations -- dates, amounts, and 
other key details. The report also made 
mention of the man's suspicions that 
Emma had caught onto the fact that 
they were using Big Shell to smuggle 
drugs.
"Huh? But-- I had no idea!" Emma 
exclaimed.
"That's not what he thought."
"I suppose I do radiate an aura of 
intelligence, don't I?"
"Guess he wasn't a very good judge of 
character."
Emma's mouth opened in indignation, 
but before she could come up with a 
retort, Snake displayed the next part of 
the file. It described the man's 
intentions to dispose of Emma before 
she exposed them to the police.
"No way!" said Emma without realizing 
it.
"Has anyone tried to hurt you before 
this?"
"No, not that I know of.... Let me see 
that for a minute." Emma began to 
examine the PDA "This file is dated the 
day before he disappeared...."
"...Implying that someone killed him 
before he could get a chance to kill 
you?"
"I'm not sure.... Yeah, maybe."
"In that case, why did he leave that file 
behind?"
Emma looked pensive for a moment. 
"...Maybe it's all a big set-up. Why
would he put the memo in such a 
conspicuous place, anyway? It's 
almost like someone wanted us to find 
it...."
Both Snake and Emma were lost in 
thought. The report certainly looked 
authentic enough, judging by its 
meticulous attention to detail. But if the 
report were real, then who was killing 
off the employees who were working 
for the syndicate? Who had forged the 
memo and hidden it in the system?
Finally, Emma murmured softly to 
herself. "I heard something once... 
about the ghost of Big Shell.... they 
say his son died of a drug overdose...."
Emma outlined her speculation to 
Snake. One of the employees, shaken 
by the death of his son, had planned to 
commit suicide. But he failed, and 
instead began wandering around Big 
Shell as a specter of his former self. 
It is believed that he wanders around 
Big Shell even now, maintaining a deep 
hatred of drugs and the people who sell 
them. One day, he discovered that Big 
Shell was being used to smuggle 
drugs....
"But no one would ever believe a story 
like that, right?" Emma tried to smile, 
but all she could manage was a small 
twitch at the corner of her mouth.#C0

column2:
"Snake, j'ai un service  te demander," dit
Otacon.
Snake frona les sourcils. Les  services 
d'Otacon sont toujours synonymes d'ennuis,
se dit-il.
"Ne compte pas sur moi. Je ne sais pas ce
que tu as en tte cette fois, mais tes
croisades  la noix auxquelles personne ne
comprend rien, c'est fini pour moi."
"Ce n'est rien de tout cela. C'est... ma
sur."
"Ta sur ?"
"Oui, ma sur Emma." Otacon raconta son
histoire d'un ton grave. Il venait d'apprendre
que sa demi-sur, qu'il avait perdue de vue
depuis longtemps, travaillait comme
programmeuse sur une usine de
dcontamination maritime, appele la Big
Shell, dans la Baie de Manhattan.
"Attends. La Big Shell... n'est-ce pas l
que... ?"
"Prcisment. Donc toi aussi tu es au
courant."
Il y avait rcemment eu une srie de morts
accidentelles parmi les employs de la Big
Shell. Beaucoup de bruits circulaient sur la
cause de leur mort. On parlait d'un tueur en
srie en fuite, d'employs qui perdaient la
tte  cause de la rclusion et mme de
fantmes. Symbole de responsabilit
cologique, la Big Shell tait devenue un
sujet lucratif pour les journaux.
"Je suis inquiet pour Emma. Tu veux aller
vrifier qu'elle ne craint rien ?"
Snake fut un signe de refus de la main.
"Adresse-toi  la police."
"Tu sais bien qu'ils ne lveront pas le petit
doigt."
"Et tu t'imagines que moi je le ferai ?"
"J'ai un mauvais pressentiment. Va voir pour
moi, tu veux ?"
"Vas-y toi-mme."
"S'il te plat !"
"Pas question !"
"Je te rpte, Snake, que j'ai VRAIMENT
un mauvais pressentiment ! Je t'en prie,
vas-y !"
"Laisse-moi tranquille !"
|
Six heures plus tard, Snake se retrouva
dans l'hliport de la Big Shell, juste au
moment o un groupe d'hommes arms
envahissait l'usine. Snake se cacha derrire
un cageot.  ce moment mme, Otacon
l'appela sur le Codec.
"...  ton avis, ce sont des terroristes ?"
demanda-t-il.
"J'ignore. Mais ce qui est clair, c'est que la
situation est un peu plus dangereuse
qu'avant. Bravo. Tu as devin juste, je
crois."
"Ce n'est pas trs rassurant. J'espre
qu'Emma ne craint rien..."
"Moi aussi," rpondit Snake. Ses yeux
s'arrtrent sur un Harrier stationn dans
l'hliport. "Et ce Harrier ? Est-ce qu'il leur
appartient ?"
"Non, il appartient aux marines. Il semble
qu'ils aient eu un problme pendant un
entranement il y a trois jours et qu'ils aient
d faire un atterrissage d'urgence."
Snake hocha la tte. "Commenons par le
commencement. Il faut savoir ce qui se
passe ici. J'entre."
"Compris. Fais attention. Au fait, Snake..."
"Quoi ?"
"Si tu trouves Emma, ne lui parle pas de
moi, d'accord ?"
"Et pourquoi ?"
"Eh bien... nous ne nous sommes pas vus
depuis longtemps... c'est trop soudain..."
Otacon hsita. Snake comprit qu'Otacon lui
cachait quelque chose. Il dcida de ne pas
insister et se dirigea vers la Big Shell.#C0

Snake se retrouva sur la passerelle reliant
les tais D et E. Sentant une prsence
proche, il se cacha vite dans l'ombre. Un
bruit de pas s'approcha et il entendit des
voix.
"Et la fille qui s'est chappe ?" dit une
voix d'homme.
"Nous l'avons perdue dans l'Etai C,"
rpondit l'autre.
Une fille ? S'agissait-il d'Emma ? Snake
dressa l'oreille.
"Perdue ? Oh, a se prsente mal," dit le
premier homme.
"Pourquoi ?"
"Eh bien, je ne connais pas tous les dtails,
mais je sais qu'il nous la faut pour la
rcuprer. Sans elle, nous sommes
coincs."
Snake jeta un coup d'il furtif sur les deux
hommes. Ils taient en tenue militaire, mais
n'avaient pas vraiment l'allure de soldats.
Le premier homme poursuivit.#C0

column2:
Snake s'approcha doucement de la fille, qui
se tapit dans le coin du casier mtallique.
"C'est toi Emma ?"
"Qui es-tu ? Comment connais-tu mon
nom !?"
"Du calme," dit Snake, en essayant de la
rassurer. "Je suis de ton ct. Je suis venu
te sauver !"
"Tu es... de mon ct ?"
"Oui."
"Tu es venu me sauver ?"
"Oui."
"... Vraiment ?"
"Vraiment."
Emma regarda Snake d'un air suspicieux.
"... Je ne t'inspire pas confiance ?"
demanda Snake.
"Pourquoi, il n'y a pas de miroir chez toi ?"
Snake commena  protester, mais Emma
le coupa.
"Qu'importe. Pourquoi exactement es-tu
venu me sauver ?"
Snake se souvint de ce qu'Otacon lui avait
dit : surtout, ne pas mentionner son nom.
"Je ne peux pas te le dire."
"Et pourquoi ?"
"Parce que je ne peux pas."
Emma dvisagea Snake de la tte aux
pieds. Elle n'avait pas l'air franchement
convaincue, mais semblait moins sur ses
gardes.
"... Tu sais, pour un hros, tu n'as pas l'air
trs convaincant. Mais tu n'as pas une trop
mauvaise tte non plus. Comment
t'appelles-tu ?"
"Solid Snake."
Emma se leva soudain et prit Snake par
l'oreille.
"H-ho ? Habla francs? Je t'ai demand
ton NOM, pas ton SURNOM. Pure, il en
tient une couche !" Emma relcha l'oreille
de Snake et le regarda droit dans les yeux.
"Quel - est - ton - VRAI - nom ?"
"Je l'ai perdu."
"Pardon ?"
"Dans mon mtier, on n'a pas besoin de
nom."
Emma frona les sourcils. "... Hum. Tu n'es
peut-tre pas mchant, mais tu es bizarre.
Enfin. Donc... Solid ?"
"Appelle-moi Snake." Snake soupira. a le
fatiguait de parler  cette mme.
"Eh bien, tu n'es pas compliqu, comme
mec. Bon, d'accord, SNAKE, tu..."
Snake la coupa. "Laisse-moi te poser
quelques questions, tu veux ?"
"... Bon, d'accord."
"Pourquoi est-ce que les terroristes te
cherchent ?"
"Sans doute parce qu'ils me trouvent
irrsistiblement belle."
Snake ne trouva pas de rponse  cela.
Emma eut l'air un peu due.
"... Ou peut-tre parce que j'ai chang le
mot de passe du systme et qu'ils ne
peuvent plus y accder."
"Ce qui veut dire ?"
Emma expliqua. Elle avait vu les terroristes
essayer d'effectuer une opration sur le
systme informatique de la Big Shell. Puis,
aprs les avoir distraits et s'tre chappe,
elle avait modifi le systme pour qu'ils ne
puissent plus l'utiliser. "a m'a permis de
gagner du temps et j'ai pens qu'en plus a
les agacerait."

Shell. Il vous est ordonn de dverrouiller le
systme avec la cl de contrle que la fille

rpte..."

main sur elle ? Et quelle tait cette cl de

"Qu'est-ce que tu..."

"Bien."

Elle sert  ouvrir les portes, c'est tout. La

peut avoir accs. C'est un dispositif de
vrification. En gros, tu ne peux rien
changer au systme informatique de la Big
Shell sans elle. Les terroristes la veulent
pour dverrouiller le systme..."
"Et s'ils tapaient un mot de passe comme je
l'ai fait ?"
"a ne marcherait pas. Les mots de passe
vont jusqu'au niveau de scurit 3
seulement. Aprs, il faut la cl de contrle
pour accder..."
"Tu as l'air de t'y connatre."
"Snake, es-tu sr qu'Emma ne t'a rien
donn d'autre ?"
"Oui. Et d'abord, qu'est-ce qui leur fait dire
que je l'ai ?"
"... Emma leur a peut-tre menti."
"Ou bien elle l'a donne au vrai fantme de
la Big Shell."
"Ce n'est pas possible," dit Otacon
rapidement.
"Comment peux-tu en tre si sr ?"
rtorqua Snake.
"H, tu as dis toi-mme que les fantmes
n'existent pas, non ? Dpchons-nous de
sauver Emma !"
"Tu as raison. Mais nous ne savons mme
pas o elle est..."
Dans le Codec, Snake entendit Otacon
claquer dans ses mains.
"Je sais ! Pourquoi n'y ai-je pas pens plus
tt ?"

"Emma a sa propre carte. Les cartes de
scurit de la Big Shell fonctionnent par
identification par frquence radio. Chaque
carte IFR possde une puce qui envoie les
donnes par signal radio. Les lecteurs de
carte peuvent utiliser ces signaux pour
dtecter tous les ID  moins d'une certaine
distance. Toutes les donnes de la Big Shell
sont gres par un systme intgr
accessible avec un mot de passe de niveau
3 !" Otacon parlait vite.
"... Ce qui veut dire ?" dit Snake.
"Que tu peux utiliser le nud pour savoir
dans quel tai Emma se trouve ! Snake,
essaie d'accder au nud avec le mot de
passe."
Snake fit comme Otacon l'avait dit et une
faible lumire apparut  l'cran, dans l'Etai
F.
"C'est elle. Elle est dans l'Etai F. Snake,
fais vite !"#C0

rponse. "Oh, a... admets que a nous a

"Mais qu'est-ce qui t'a pouss  faire une

"Que tu allais venir me sauver bien sr."

Emma raconta ce qu'elle avait entendu un
garde dire pendant sa captivit.
Le groupe arm qui avait pris la Big Shell

russe. Avec la collaboration de plusieurs

chaloupes chercher la drogue sur des

Shell dans la cargaison. C'est ainsi qu'elle
entrait dans le pays. La scurit ayant t
resserre dans le port ces dernires
annes, c'tait un moyen pratique et
efficace de transfrer la drogue sans

column2:
Snake et Emma arrivrent  l'Etai E. Une
bande transporteuse attira l'attention
d'Emma.
"Je sais !" s'exclama-t-elle.
"Tu sais quoi ?"
"Je sais o ils cachent la drogue." Emma se
dirigea vers le nud et se mit  taper des
commandes.
"Comment as-tu..."
"Attends, tu vas voir."
Une seconde plus tard, un carton apparut.
Emma l'ouvrit. Il tait rempli de sacs en
plastique bien rangs, remplis de poudre
blanche.
"Le groupe savait qu'en cachant la drogue 
un seul endroit, mme en choisissant la
meilleure des cachettes, quelqu'un la
dcouvrirait," dit Emma en regardant les
cartons arriver sur la bande." Ils ont donc
cach la drogue dans ces cartons et se sont
arrangs pour qu'ils circulent dans la Big
Shell sans sortir nulle part."
Snake ne pouvait qu'admirer l'intelligence
d'Emma. Il la regarda sortir son assistant
numrique et le connecter au nud.
"Qu'est-ce que tu fais ?" demanda-t-il.
"Hum. Je crois avoir trouv quelque chose
d'intressant... Ce doit tre..."
 ce moment-l, une silhouette mergea de
derrire la bande transporteuse. C'tait un
des terroristes. Ds qu'il vit Snake et
Emma, il partit en courant. Snake voulut
partir  ses trousses, mais Emma le retint
par la main.
"Attends !"
"Filons ! Il va appeler ses amis !"
"Je sais ! Attends une minute !" Emma se
mit  taper des commandes dans le nud 
une vitesse incroyable.
"Mais qu'est-ce que tu fais ?"
"Si nous filons, ils nous courront aprs.
Alors..."
En l'espace de quelques secondes, Snake
entendit un bruit d'attroupement derrire la
porte. Des bruits de pas, des voix hurlant
des ordres, des fusils qu'on arme. Ils
seraient l d'une minute  l'autre. Mais
Emma restait colle  l'cran du nud.
"Emma !" hurla Snake.
Elle quitta enfin le nud. "Voil, a devrait
aller. Bien, allons-y!"
La porte s'ouvrit en grand. 
#C0

Quelques instants plus tard, le bruit de
plusieurs coups de feu lui parvint de
derrire. Il fit volte-face. Les cris d'Emma lui
percrent les oreilles.#C0

Tous deux parvinrent  quitter l'Etai E et 
rejoindre la passerelle de connexion DE.

vers l'Etai E. Les terroristes seraient  leurs
trousses d'un moment  l'autre. Il mit une
nouvelle cartouche dans la chambre de son
revolver et cria  Emma d'avancer plus vite
vers l'Etai D. Elle rpondit d'un air
nonchalant.
"Rien ne presse, tu sais," dit-elle.
Ils attendirent un instant, mais la porte de
l'Etai E restait ferme. Un bruit de tumulte
leur parvint de l'autre ct. Les soldats
essayaient en vain de forcer la porte. Snake
se tourna vers Emma.
"Qu'est-ce que tu as fait ?"
"J'ai programm le nud pour qu'il
verrouille toutes les portes de l'Etai E une
fois que nous serions sortis. Ils ne pourront
aller nulle part." Emma avait l'air
extrmement fire d'elle. Elle n'avait pas
oubli ce qui s'tait pass dans l'Etai C
avec Snake.
Ils entrrent dans l'Etai D. Snake regarda
autour de lui. Aucun signe de l'ennemi.
Personne en vue. Les terroristes avaient d
envoyer le gros de la troupe  l'Etai E. Si
c'tait le cas, les autres tais devaient tre
pratiquement dserts. Librer les otages ne
prsenterait donc aucune difficult.
Snake et Emma traversrent l'Etai D et se
retrouvrent sur la passerelle reliant les
Shells 1 et 2. Pas d'ennemi en vue non
plus. Son sourire caractristique apparut sur
les lvres d'Emma.
"Tu vois, pas de problme. N'est-ce pas que
je suis utile ?"
"Je dois admettre que tu as fait du bon
boulot," dit Snake en hochant la tte. Il
repensa  la faon dont Emma s'tait
connecte au nud avec son assistant
numrique. "Au fait, n'as-tu pas tlcharg
quelque chose ?"
"Si. Tu as remarqu ?" Emma sortit son
assistant numrique. "En activant la bande,
j'ai trouv un fichier curieux  ct du fichier
de contrle de la bande. J'ai dcid de le
tlcharger et voil ce que j'ai trouv..."
Le fichier s'afficha sur son cran. C'tait
une note crite par un des deux employs
tus dans les accidents - ceux qui aidaient
le groupe  transvaser la drogue dans la Big
Shell. Il expliquait qu'il cooprait avec les
Russes uniquement parce que sa femme et
son enfant avaient t pris en otages. Mais
l'an dernier, il apprit qu'ils avaient t tus
en essayant de s'enfuir. Il sombra dans le
dsespoir et songea mme  se tuer. C'est
alors qu'il eut une vision. L'heure n'tait pas
venue pour lui de mourir. Il lui fallait se
venger d'abord. Il ferait payer au groupe ce
qu'il avait fait  sa femme et  son fils.
L'anne suivante, il labora un plan
ingnieux. Il allait faire semblant d'tre tu
par un groupe rival qui essayait de voler la
drogue. Cela dclencherait une guerre entre
les deux groupes qui finiraient par
s'entre-tuer. Tout d'abord, il orchestra sa
propre mort. Juste aprs, il tua l'homme que
le groupe avait envoy on observation 
l'aide d'une grue. Peu de temps aprs, il
poussa l'homme envoy par la Mafia pour
enquter sur les deux incidents par-dessus
bord. Comme il l'avait prvu, une guerre
clata entre les groupes rivaux. Tout tant
maintenant en place, il pouvait enfin reposer
en paix. Il dit qu'il allait bientt rejoindre sa
femme et son fils. Pour finir, il implorait le
lecteur de dire une prire pour sa femme et
son fils. Le fichier s'arrtait l. Il datait d'il y
a trois jours.
Snake leva la tte. "a veut sans doute dire
que le fantme de la Big Shell est mort?"
Emma ne pouvait masquer sa surprise.
"Je... je suppose... J'ai tlcharg un autre
fichier..."
Les oreilles de Snake perurent un bruit au
loin, comme si quelque chose volait dans
l'air. Instantanment, il attrapa Emma et la
serra contre lui. Il y eut une explosion. La
force de l'impact les souleva de leurs pieds.
"Qu'est-ce que c'tait ?" marmonna Emma
dans ses bras.
Un vent puissant leur fouettait les joues. Le
Harrier planait au-dessus de la passerelle,
loin de la fournaise de l'explosion.
"Oh non... Il pouvait sortir quelque chose
de l'Etai E..." murmura Emma, l'air
compltement abasourdi.
Le Harrier balayait la passerelle  la
mitraillette. Snake et Emma s'enfuirent vers
l'entre de la passerelle D.
"Qu'est-ce qu'on fait maintenant ?"
"Il va falloir l'abattre."
"Comment ?"
"Je vais bien trouver."
"Tu plaisantes !?" Emma se mit 
protester, mais avant qu'elle ait pu terminer,
Snake l'avait pousse derrire la porte de
l'Etai D.
"Qu'est-ce que tu fais ?" demanda-t-elle.
"Reste l ! Quoi qu'il arrive, ne sors pas de
l !"
"Mais !"
"coute-moi pour une fois, tu veux ?"
Snake lui sourit. "J'ai promis  quelqu'un de
te ramener avec moi."
"Quoi ?"
La porte se referma.
Snake entendit le bruit d'un hlicoptre qui
approchait. C'tait Otacon dans son
Kasatka.
"Prends a, Snake !"
Otacon balana une bote du cockpit. Des
missiles Stinger. Avec a, les forces
devenaient plus quilibres. Snake se
retourna et se prpara  affronter
le Harrier.#C0

column2:
Le Harrier perdit le contrle et s'crasa au
pied de l'Etai 1. Tandis que Snake le
regardait s'craser, la porte de l'Etai D
s'ouvrit. Emma jeta un coup d'il prudent.
On aurait dit qu'elle pleurait.
"C'est fini."
"Tu en as mis du temps."
"Dsol."
"a va ? Tu n'es pas bless ?"
"Non, a va."
Snake et Emma librrent les employs de
la Big Shell pris en otages et appelrent la
police sur la radio de l'usine. Les renforts
seraient bientt l. Les terroristes taient
toujours prisonniers de l'Etai E. Snake et
Emma dcidrent d'aller dans l'hliport de
l'Etai I en attendant les renforts.

"Au fait, Emma, ne m'as-tu pas parl d'un
deuxime fichier ?"
"Oh, c'est vrai. J'ai russi  dnicher les
fichiers personnels des types qui
travaillaient avec le groupe. Le premier type
qui est mort, celui qui a crit la note, avait
un fichier cod par mot de passe dans son
dossier. Je l'ai tlcharg et..." Quelque
chose s'afficha  l'cran.#C0

D'aprs Emma, la puce du fichier avait t

t endommag, dit-elle. La salle des

column2:
Snake entendit le bruit d'un hlicoptre qui
approchait.
Emma regarda dans le ciel.
"C'est la police ?"
Le Kasatka apparut. En voyant son ombre,
Emma pencha la tte d'un ct, berlue.
"Ce n'est pas la police. Qui est-ce ?"
Snake regarda le Kasatka. "C'est mon taxi."
Le visage d'Otacon sortit du cockpit. Snake
vit la peur et l'apprhension dans ses yeux,
mais il y avait quelque chose d'autre -
comme une menaante dtermination.
"Je crois qu'il a de la place pour toi aussi."
"Moi ?"
"Tu vas comprendre."
Le Kasatka commena  descendre. Le vent
produit par les rotors leur fouettait le visage.
Emma ramena ses cheveux en arrire.
Comme l'hlicoptre approchait, Emma
reconnut la silhouette du pilote. Elle en eut
le souffle coup. Ses yeux restaient figs.
Elle ne bougeait pas, comme cloue sur
place. Des larmes se mirent  couler sur
ses joues. Le Kasatka atterrit enfin. Sans
mme attendre que les rotors aient fini de
tourner, Emma courut  la rencontre de son
frre.#C0

column2:
Un fichier s'afficha  l'cran LCD.
C'tait un rapport adress au groupe au
sujet de son trafic de drogue. D'aprs son
apparence, ce n'tait encore qu'un brouillon
et il n'avait pas d tre envoy. Il contenait
toutefois une mine d'informations sur les
activits du groupe ? des dates, des
chiffres et autres renseignements capitaux.
Le rapport indiquait galement que l'homme
souponnait Emma d'avoir dcouvert qu'ils
utilisaient la Big Shell pour faire entrer de la
drogue dans le pays.
"Quoi ? Mais j'ignorais compltement !"
s'exclama Emma...
"Ce n'est pas ce qu'il pensait."
"Je suppose que je respire l'intelligence."
"Je crois plutt qu'il manquait de jugement."
Emma ouvrit la bouche d'indignation, mais
avant qu'elle n'ait pu rpliquer quoi que ce
soit, Snake avait affich le reste du fichier.
L'homme disait avoir l'intention de se
dbarrasser d'Emma avant qu'elle ne les
dnonce.
"Non !" dit Emma sans s'en rendre compte.
"Est-ce que quelqu'un a essay de te faire
du mal ?"
"Pas que je sache... Laisse-moi regarder."
Emma commena  examiner l'assistant
numrique. "Le fichier date de la veille de sa
mort..."
"... Ce qui suppose qu'il a t tu avant de
pouvoir te tuer ?"
"Je ne sais pas... Oui, peut-tre."
"Mais alors, pourquoi avoir laiss ce fichier
derrire lui ?"
Emma rflchit un instant. "... C'est
peut-tre mont de toutes pices. Et
d'abord, pourquoi laisser ce fichier  un
endroit aussi vident ? C'est comme si
quelqu'un voulait que nous le trouvions..."
Snake et Emma taient perdus dans leurs
penses. Le rapport semblait authentique,
tellement il regorgeait de dtails prcis.
Mais alors, qui tuait les employs travaillant
pour le groupe ? Qui avait cr la note et
l'avait cache l ?
Enfin, Emma se dit  elle-mme en
murmurant : "J'ai entendu dire...  propos
du fantme... que son fils est mort d'une
overdose..."
Emma fit part de son hypothse  Snake.
Un des employs, perturb par la mort de
son fils, avait prvu de se suicider. Mais il
choua et se mit  errer dans la Big Shell
tel un spectre. Certains croient qu'il est
toujours l, avec sa haine viscrale de la
drogue et de ceux qui la vendent. Un jour, il
dcouvrit que la Big Shell tait utilise pour
le trafic de drogue...
"Personne ne croirait une telle histoire,
n'est-ce pas ?" Emma essaya de sourire,
mais n'y parvint pas.#C0
