column2:
"Vamp, dime, por qu has seguido con
este linchamiento cuando sabas que no
tena ningn sentido?"

Un tic nervioso hizo que la boca de Vamp
se moviera.

"Porque s que tena sentido."

La detencin de Jackson haba sido la gota
que colm el vaso, la reputacin Dead Cell
no poda ser ya peor. Decan que Dead Cell
era una deshonra para todo el ejrcito de
los Estados Unidos y un grupo de
perdedores... El ejrcito detuvo a Jackson
como cabeza de turco. Pero haba ms.
Tambin enterraron todos los archivos que
contenan informacin sobre las operaciones
exitosas de Dead Cell. Era un destino peor
que la muerte, era la deshonra.

"Matamos a mucha gente; civiles, mujeres,
nios, ancianos... Algunos de ellos no
estaban armados. Otros ni siquiera se
resistieron. Hubo algunos que incluso
suplicaron por sus vidas. Pero les matamos
a todos. No lo hicimos por gusto. Era
nuestra misin. El trabajo sucio, sas eran
nuestras misiones. Todo el mundo odiaba
esas misiones, pero alguien tena que
hacerlas. As que nos las encomendaron a
nosotros. Y la gente como O'Brien tiene
esa reputacin impoluta gracias a que
nosotros nos ensuciamos las manos de
sangre y a que nos despertamos vctimas
de pesadillas que desgraciadamente hemos
vivido..." Vamp apret el puo. 
"Somos los ms rastreros de los
hombres? Probablemente s. Pero los ms
rastreros soldados? Eso s que no. No
permitir que se cuestione y que se manche
nuestro nombre y nuestro honor. Eso era lo
nico que tenamos! Pero ahora... incluso
nos han negado ese poco orgullo que nos
quedaba. Por eso me alist a esta misin."

"Quieres decir tu "linchamiento"?"

"As es. Si mato por venganza, la gente
empezar a cuestionarse un montn de
cosas. Puede que incluso piensen que el
Coronel Jackson era inocente. Cuanto ms
muertes se produzcan, ms nos creer la
gente. Ms creern en su inocencia..."#C0

respira lo que t llamas "mierda". No

estaban vacos. Su expresin no era la de
alguien que haba ganado algo, si no la de
alguien que haba perdido algo. Entonces
me di cuenta de todo.

column2:
Vamp gru.
"No poda decir nada..."
"Fue Jackson? pregunt una voz. Era
Dolph. Probablemente haba escuchado el
ruido de nuestra lucha y por eso consigui
localizarnos.
Vamp no respondi. Dolph se arrodill al
lado de Vamp y le repiti la misma
pregunta.
"Slo hay una persona a la que ests
intentando proteger. Es Jackson?"
Vamp se gir. Dolph cogi la cara de Vamp
con ambas manos y le dio la vuelta de
nuevo.
"Se lo voy a preguntar a l de todas las
formas. Fue Jackson?!"
Vamp apart las manos de Dolph. 
"S..."
Dijo Vamp al mismo tiempo que al toser,
sangre brot de su boca.
"El Capitn se autoculp todo el tiempo.
Quera buscar una forma de restaurar la
reputacin y el honor de Dead Cell. Era de
lo nico que hablaba en el crcel, da tras
da, como si estuviera posedo. Un da me
llam. Quera hablar de este
"linchamiento"."
Un tic se asom en la cara de Vamp. No
creo que fuera a causa del dolor.
"Ya no quedaba nada del brillante Capitn
que yo haba conocido. Estaba al borde. O
quizs ya estaba totalmente perdido... No
me quedaba ms remedio que obedecerle."
"As que Jackson te orden que hicieras
esto?" pregunt.
"No. Fue idea ma. Tena que acabar con
esto. Por que l lo haba descubierto..."
"l?"
"O'Brien."
Vamp continu.
De alguna forma, O'Brien se haba enterado
de que Jackson estaba detrs del
"linchamiento". Por eso O'Brien haba
pedido que Vamp fuera puesto bajo su
mando, como miembro de Dead Cell. Vamp
se dio cuenta de lo que O'Brien planeaba:
fortalecer su autoridad demostrando al
ejrcito que l poda controlar al tan
problemtico Dead Cell, al mismo tiempo
que sus poderes se vean aumentados al
controlar al equipo de operaciones extra
legales. Vamp se neg. Dead Cell no sera
utilizado como un instrumento del gobierno.
As que O'Brien le amenaz con hacer
pblico el hecho de que Jackson estaba
ordenando a Vamp que llevara a cabo esos
asesinatos. Y si lo haca, el nombre de
Dead Cell se ensuciara para siempre. As
es como O'Brien trabajaba.
La nica solucin para Vamp era matar a
O'Brien. Vamp le sigui el rollo para poder
matarle en este ejercicio. No poda hacer
que era un accidente. Sera una revuelta.
Dead Cell sera disuelto y l probablemente
morira. Pero era mejor que vender su
orgullo.
Dolph explot.
"No digas bobadas! Si era lo que l
quera, haberle entregado a Dead Cell.
No tenas que arriesgar tu vida por eso!
Por qu lo hiciste?"
Vamp mir hacia otro lado. Al mirarle,
Dolph se dio cuenta de algo.
"... Hay algo ms, no?"
Paralizado por la mirada de Dolph, Vamp
habl derrotado.
"O'Brien hizo que su enemigo poltico
tambin participara en este ejercicio.
O'Brien me orden que matara a su
enemigo, a ti... Scott, era una prueba para
demostrar que estaba bajo su mando...
Pero eso era lo ltimo que yo hara..."
Dolph murmur asombradsimo,
"Eso es una locura..."
Vamp me mir suplicando.
"Ahora mtame. Ya no queda nada en este
mundo que yo quiera ver."
"Ni lo suees. Yo no acato tus rdenes," le
dije.
Vamp dej caer su cabeza. Yo continu.
"... Es ms, creo que tienes que vivir. No
hagas que la gente que te quiere sufra
todava ms."
"Gracias..." dijo Dolph.#C0

column2:
I opened the door to Strut B. I went 
out on the AB connecting bridge. No 
enemies sighted. Otacon gave me 
instructions via Codec.
"Listen carefully, Snake. I'll explain 
again. Our target this time is that 
mysterious unidentified monster that's 
got the whole world in an uproar. They 
call it the Gurlugon."
What is he talking about? The only 
ones in an uproar are Otacon and 
Mei Ling, and I bet they're the only 
ones using that nickname, too. That's 
what I was thinking, anyway. But I 
didn't say anything. Otacon continued.
"I think you already know this, but do 
NOT hurt the target! Take a picture of 
it before it has a chance to get away. 
You've made it this far, so don't do 
anything stupid!"
My hands were tied. Ridiculous or not, 
a mission is a mission. I made up my 
mind, and began walking across the AB
connecting bridge. #C0

You've made it this far, so don't do 
anything stupid!"
My hands were tied. Ridiculous or not, 
a mission is a mission. I made up my 
mind, and began walking across the AB
connecting bridge. #C0

column2:
I stared in stunned silence at the 
churning whirlpool the sea had become. 
The surface of the sea was beginning 
to rise. No question about it, something
huge was getting ready to make an 
appearance. My mysterious, ludicrous 
quest, my so-called "Monster Search 
Mission," looked to be coming to an 
unexpected conclusion...
|
How did I get involved in this ridiculous 
mission? It all began three days ago. 
I was testing Otacon's latest invention, 
the VR system, at Philanthropy's 
hideout in New York.#C0

column2:
I nodded reluctantly. Otacon asked me 
with pride:
"What did you think about the new VR 
system?"
"Not bad."
"That's all?" Unsatisfied, he cocked 
his head.
"I can't believe it, to tell you the truth. 
I didn't expect it to work so well."
"I know! The VR system incorporates 
something called the Koppelthorn Engine.
I just got it the other day."
"The Koppelthorn Engine?"
Hearing the question, Otacon removed 
his glasses, a smile on his face.
"The Koppelthorn Engine is a quantum 
calculation system that's been getting 
a lot of attention in certain quarters 
recently. You know about quantum 
computing, right?" began Otacon.
He went on and on, q-bits this and 
Tensor products that. For the next two 
hours and thirty-seven minutes, 
I regretted my stupidity in having asked.
"...In short, it allows the construction of
virtual-reality environments containing 
a hitherto unprecedented amount of 
information. That information is 
converted into a signal and conveyed 
into your brain via the headset, directly 
synthesizing information for each of 
your senses while simultaneously 
cutting off feedback from your actual 
body. That way, it's possible to realize 
a virtual reality environment that is 
completely indistinguishable from the 
real world, down to lights, sounds, even
your sense of smell and touch."
He took a breather. I couldn't miss my 
opportunity.
"I see, I understand now..." I said, 
trying to get up out of the seat. 
But Otacon stopped me.
"Wait a second. Let's try it again. 
The goal of the next scenario will be to 
eliminate the enemies and secure an 
escape path for the hostages on Big 
Shell."
I guess Otacon just couldn't wait to try 
out his new toy. Reluctantly, I took the 
seat again. Otacon continued his 
briefing.
"Your mission is to eliminate all 
enemies within a certain period of time.
Ready? Here we go!"
I put the headset back on and closed 
my eyes. A burst of light flashed 
through my eyelids. The next moment, 
I found myself surrounded by a world 
I could hardly believe was a mere 
construct.#C0

column2:
The VR simulation ended. The all-too-
real virtual reality disappeared, and the 
senses returned to my body. I removed 
the headset. 
"How was it?" asked Otacon. I told him
what I'd noticed during my two trials. 
"It's well done, no question. But it 
feels kind of unnatural, like something's
wrong with my senses."
"Unnatural? In what way?"
"It's tough to explain, but... I feel like 
I'm possessing someone else's body...."
"That's because of the pseudo-signal 
filling your brain. Theoretically, it should
be possible to replicate the exact same 
stimulus as from the sensory structures
of your physical body."
Midway through my discussion with 
Otacon, the door opened, and in strode 
Mei Ling.
"Hey, check this out!"
Mei Ling threw us the tabloid she'd 
brought with her.#C0

column2:
It was an article describing the 
appearance of some kind of huge 
creature near Big Shell. The title 
shouted, "A Monster at Big Shell!?" 
Completely ridiculous.
"So what?" I said without hesitation. 
Mei Ling blinked in surprise.
"'So what'?! It's a monster, Snake!"
Otacon hit the table.
"That's right! It's a monster!"
"That picture has to be fake." 
It was the most normal opinion in the 
world, but you wouldn't have known by 
the way they glared at me. Finally they 
simply decided to ignore me.
"It sounds incredible, doesn't it, 
Mei Ling? A monster in New York? 
It's amazing!"
"I agree! It's amazing! Too 
amazing!!"
"So it's at Big Shell.... I want to go and 
see it...."
"Hey, Otacon, I have an idea. How 
about catching the monster? What do 
you say?"
"Great idea! Let's get him! It'd be a 
real boon to biology -- no, I take that 
back! To ALL of the sciences!"
"That's right! Hey, do you think we 
could get a lot of customers if we built 
a monster zoo?"
"Of course! Judging from the dorsal 
fin, I think this monster must have 
come from underwater.... What do you 
think?"
"Maybe. What about making stuffed 
animals or T-shirts?"
"Not bad! But I can't help thinking that 
it might be a messenger from space, 
you know?" 
"Oh, totally. But we'd better register a 
trademark first."
They excitedly kept on with what 
seemed to be a totally disjointed 
conversation. I couldn't believe they 
were actually considering it, but I had 
to ask.
"Hey, I hope you're not serious about 
catching this thing...."
Otacon regarded me with utter shock.
"Wake up, Snake! We're talking about 
a monster here!"
Mei Ling kicked a chair.
"He's right! This is about a monster!"
"But..."
Otacon leaned toward me. 
"A monster of unknown origin has 
appeared! As a scientist, I can't 
simply ignore it!"
"Do I have to remind you about 
Philanthropy's financial situation?! 
We don't even know if we have enough
to cover our rent this month!" snapped
Mei Ling, fire in her eyes.
"But..."
"What do you propose instead of 
catching it?!"
"Are you just going to quietly let this 
opportunity slip by?! You coward!"
"But, but..."
Otacon and Mei Ling kept up their 
simultaneous tirade as I hesitated.
"We've got to do it!"
"We've got to do it!"
At this point, there was nothing to say 
except "Okay."
That's the story. And so I came to Big 
Shell. That was three hours ago.#C0

column2:
I contacted Otacon via Codec as 
I entered Strut C. 
"What's up, Snake? Found any 
clues?" asked Otacon.
"Negative. But I've seen some strange 
people wandering around."
I told Otacon about the soldiers I'd 
seen on the CD connecting bridge. 
Otacon replied:
"I bet they're trying to get Gurlugon, 
just like we are."
"I don't think..."
"It has to be!" he swore with 
confidence.
"Anyway, just move ahead without 
getting caught. Most of the sightings 
of Gurlugon have been southwest of 
Big Shell. Head for the AB connecting 
bridge."
I'd come this far, so there was nothing 
to do but follow Otacon. I started 
moving towards the AB connecting 
bridge.#C0

column2:
"Get out of my way!" screamed Olga.
She wasn't armed. She didn't seem to 
be making a move to attack. I began 
talking to her as I holstered my gun.
"What are you doing here?"
Olga smiled a little. But something about
her smile wasn't right. She looked so 
different. She didn't carry the sense of 
darkness and tragedy I remembered. 
In fact, she looked like a totally different
woman.
"Don't get too friendly. I'm not the me 
that you know, and I don't know the 
me that you do know."
"What are you talking about?"
"I'm looking for the key to get back to 
my universe. And that strange creature 
is it. It doesn't belong in your universe. 
Neither do I. We're from a different 
place. And your universe is in for 
trouble, too, if you just ignore things!"
I just couldn't wrap my brain around 
Olga's story. I was lost. Grinding her 
teeth, Olga looked down to the surface 
of the sea.
"Damn. He's getting away. Listen! 
Check the VR system! It's allowing 
you to peek into another universe. 
That's what's causing all this trouble!" 
shouted Olga as she jumped from the 
connecting bridge.
"Wait!"
I leaned over the railing, but Olga had 
already disappeared into the sea. 
Olga's henchmen were jumping into the 
sea one after the other.
I was left on the connecting bridge 
alone. I couldn't see Gurlugon 
anymore.#C0

column2:
My photo of Gurlugon sat on the table 
at the hideout. 
"No sign today?" I asked Mei Ling.
"No. Looks like it hasn't shown up 
today, either."
It had been a week. No new sightings 
of Gurlugon. No one knew where he'd 
show up next. 
Maybe he'd never show up ever again.
I believed Olga. It didn't seem like she 
was lying, and what's more, the 
existence of that ridiculous monster 
was proof in and of itself. There was no 
way something like that could live in 
our world, but it might be possible in 
another. Otacon brought up a theory 
about "parallel universes."
As usual, Otacon gave far more of an 
explanation than necessary. But in a 
nutshell, the idea was that rather than a 
single universe, there were countless 
universes existing in parallel. That 
meant that one universe might be 
exactly the same as mine, except the 
number of hairs on my head was off by 
one. In another universe, civilization 
might have sprung from paramecia. 
There could even be a universe full of 
monsters. Otacon thought these 
universes were supposed to be mutually 
exclusive, but for some reason had 
begun randomly intersecting. That was 
how the Olga we knew became switched
with an Olga from a parallel universe, 
and how that monster came to be in 
ours. And Otacon warned that the 
phenomenon seemed to be progressing 
as we spoke.
But if his theory was correct, we were in
for big trouble. For example, it was 
possible that in an hour, I might switch 
with another version of myself from a 
different universe. Otacon might have 
already been switched with a different 
Otacon. What would happen to us if we 
switched to a universe, say, where the 
Moon was about to collide with the Earth
or something? It was simply impossible 
to predict what might happen next.
Fortunately, the moon hadn't smashed 
into us yet - or at least not in our 
universe. Of course, that didn't 
guarantee we'd be safe tomorrow.
"How's the analysis of the VR system 
coming?"
Otacon shook his head.
"I'm not getting anything at all...."
|
Otacon looked sick when he heard Olga 
had said that the VR system was the 
root of the problem. He told me that the 
Koppelthorn Engine, the heart of the 
new VR system, was a quantum 
computational device designed by 
Dr. Koppelthorn, but the principles 
behind it remained unknown. He 
opened the housing, a literal black box,
and found nothing inside except some 
mysterious circuits, clattering gears, 
and what appeared to be some iron 
spheres. But somehow, it worked. 
That's probably why it was such a 
source of excitement for some people. 
Pseudo-science aficionados had 
examined the thing, but the only 
conclusions thus far had centered 
around the possibility that it made use 
of components from UFOs or artifacts 
from a lost civilization. Meaning nobody 
had figured out what made it tick. And 
what's more, nobody had ever seen this 
Dr. Koppelthorn himself or herself, 
either.
So what was the connection between 
this mysterious VR system and the 
collision of the parallel universes? Olga 
had said that the root of the problem 
was the VR system's "peeking" into 
other universes. But Mei Ling had her 
own theory. The Koppelthorn Engine-
based VR system wasn't simply 
constructing a virtual reality through its 
calculations, but managed to get around 
the wall separating the parallel 
universes, peering into parallel realities 
that satisfied certain requirements, and 
incorporating that information into the 
VR system's virtual reality construct. 
Perhaps that observation and 
interference was creating the 
disturbance in the parallel universes. 
But that wasn't all, said Mei Ling. 
Perhaps Olga was searching for the 
Gurlugon because it was the cause of 
the distortion among the parallel 
universes. The Gurlugon had become 
the fulcrum around which space had 
warped. And if that was true, there 
would be no way to stop the distortion 
without getting rid of the Gurlugon 
itself.
And for that reason, we continued 
searching for the Gurlugon. We'd lost 
all trace of the monster, and hadn't 
made any further progress into 
analyzing the VR system. But the 
disturbance of the parallel universes 
might well be continuing. It was 
possible that some of the universes 
might even be in peril. And it was 
equally possible that our universe 
could follow the same path moments 
later. We were completely frazzled.
|
Suddenly, Mei Ling spoke.
"If killing Gurlugon will make things 
right, there might be a way."
"What do you mean?" 
Otacon raised his face, and Mei Ling 
began her explanation.
"If it's true that the VR system can 
interfere with other parallel universes, 
why not try killing Gurlugon within the 
VR system? That could mean we're 
actually killing the original Gurlugon, 
and the Gurlugon in our universe could 
disappear...."
"Isn't that just a little too extreme?" 
objected Otacon.
To which Mei Ling shot back:
"We can't just sit back and stare at the 
photo! We've got to do something!
You agree with me, right, Snake?!"
"I'm not sure...." I answered. Her logic 
seemed extreme no matter how I 
looked at it. But at the same time, I had
the feeling that I'd end up doing it 
anyway. Doing something for the sake 
of doing it wasn't the answer, but I had 
to agree we still hadn't come up with a 
solution to the problem.
A few hours later, I squared off against 
Gurlugon inside the VR system.#C0

"Isn't that just a little too extreme?" 
objected Otacon.
To which Mei Ling shot back:
"We can't just sit back and stare at the 
photo! We've got to do something!
You agree with me, right, Snake?!"
"I'm not sure...." I answered. Her logic 
seemed extreme no matter how I 
looked at it. But at the same time, I had
the feeling that I'd end up doing it 
anyway. Doing something for the sake 
of doing it wasn't the answer, but I had 
to agree we still hadn't come up with a 
solution to the problem.
A few hours later, I squared off against 
Gurlugon inside the VR system.#C0

column2:
I stopped the VR system. As I removed 
the headset, Otacon yelled at me.
"Snake, what are you doing?!"
"I just didn't feel like it."
"What are you talking about?! Do you 
realize the trouble we're in?! We're 
doing it again!"
I replaced the headset on my head. 
Otacon took control of the system. 
The VR simulation began again.#C0

column2:
Gurlugon defeated, we turned the VR 
system off. But somehow, I still wasn't 
convinced. I removed the headset and 
spoke to Otacon.
"So. Do you think we really did it?"
Otacon shrugged. Looked like he felt 
the same way I did.
Just then, Mei Ling said:
"Of course the mission has succeeded."
I saw a wicked smile on her face.
"We've just lost the only way to restore 
the parallel universes to normal."
"What did you say?!" I said, rising 
from the seat. Mei Ling responded:
"There's no question that the Gurlugon 
was the singularity that represented the
warp in the parallel universes. But the 
only way to restore space as we know 
it wasn't destroying the singularity. The 
solution was to capture the singularity, 
perform a counter-unitary conversion via
the Koppelthorn Engine, thereby 
dispersing the wave function to its state 
before convergence..."
Mei Ling continued, her voice full of 
satisfaction.
"Anyway, the disappearance of the 
singularity means the disappearance of 
the only method to restore space, too."
"Who are you?!"
Mei Ling sneered at Otacon's cry.
"To borrow Olga's words, I'm not the 
Mei Ling you know. But no hard 
feelings, okay? I was just following 
someone's orders to complete a certain 
objective."
"Someone? Who?" I asked her back.
"My husband." Mei Ling replied sweetly.
"I believe he's called Solidus in your 
universe."
"Solidus?!" we screamed without 
thinking. Mei Ling slowly pointed at a 
wall and said: 
"Oh, speak of the devil..."
Just then, the wall exploded. Debris 
poured from the gap. Dust enveloped 
the area. And Solidus Snake, clad in a 
powered suit, stood in the middle. 
Solidus said to Mei Ling, 
"Kept you waiting, huh?"
"Honey!"
Mei Ling threw herself into Solidus' 
arms.
I dove for Solidus. He fired a missile 
from his snake hand. A dazzling flash. 
An explosion. I was thrown against the 
wall. I lost consciousness momentarily. 
By the time I managed to get to my 
feet, I saw Solidus cradling Mei Ling 
and escaping through the hole he'd just 
blown in the wall. #C0

column2:
In the end, I couldn't keep up with 
Solidus. Otacon and I discussed what 
to do next as we stood in our 
half-destroyed hideout. If they were 
telling the truth, we'd just lost the way 
to restore the balance of the parallel 
universes. But there still had to be 
something we could do.... Finally, 
Otacon spoke.
"What about Olga?"
It wasn't a bad idea. The Olga we'd run 
into at Big Shell seemed to have a 
good grasp of the situation. She might 
be able to come up with some kind of 
solution. There was just one problem. 
Where could she be?
I told Otacon my concerns, and he 
nodded with confidence.
"I have an idea."#C0

column2:
"So, what's your skill?" asked Otacon. 
A beautiful black woman with a slender 
build was sitting in front of us. She 
was too cheerful. She laughed far too 
often.
"I've got, like, really good luck!"
"Good luck?! Is that a skill?"
"You betcha!"
Somewhat dismissively, I watched 
Otacon continue questioning the 
applicant. 
Otacon had placed an ad entitled 
"Wanted: Gurlugon Search Team 
Members!" in the city's main 
newspaper the other day. "Let's catch 
the mysterious monster with our own 
hands! We have credible information 
about where the creature will appear. 
Experience a plus. Details to be 
discussed during an interview...."
Unbelievably, quite a few people had 
shown up. We'd already met with more 
than ten people, but there was still no 
sign of Olga.
"We'll contact you later."
"I really look forward to hearing from 
ya!"
The woman stood up, gave him a big 
smile, and left. I said to Otacon, 
"Do you really think this is going to 
work?!"
"She has to be on the lookout for 
information about Gurlugon. She'll 
show up."
"But all we've gotten so far are 
weirdos! Like that old man whose skill 
was back flips and sliding, and..."
"Yeah, he was funny!"
"Hey!"
Obviously, Otacon was getting a kick 
out of the whole scene.
"Relax. Let's wait a little bit longer. 
Next!" yelled Otacon. The door 
opened. Lo and behold, in walked Olga.#C0

column2:
Back in the remains of our hideout, 
we explained the situation to Olga. 
After hearing our full account, Olga 
told us that there was still a way out. 
"It's true that the Gurlugon singularity 
might have been erased, but that 
doesn't necessarily mean that all of 
singularities in all of the parallel 
universes have been."
A glimmer of hope flashed through 
Otacon's eyes.
"You mean there are other 
singularities?"
"Most likely. But their forms and 
locations in the parallel universes are 
unknown. They won't be easy to find." 
"We have some data about Gurlugon. 
If we analyze its pattern, scan the 
vicinity of the strange attractor with VR,
maybe we can..."
Otacon and Olga continued their 
technical discussion. The end result, 
said Otacon, was settling on a method 
to find the singularities of other parallel 
universes by continuously and finely 
adjusting the wave function parameter 
of the VR system to mimic the unique 
pattern generated by a singularity. 
In other words, it looked like I'd 
have to make it through a series of VR 
constructs. Preparations were made 
faster than I expected.
I returned to the seat of the VR system.
Otacon said, "I'll tell you as soon as I 
locate a singularity. Until then, I want 
you to continue clearing VR stages. 
But be careful. I don't think Solidus will 
just take this sitting down. You may 
run into traps. Stay alert!"
Otacon initialized the VR system. 
A virtual reality spread before my eyes.#C0

column2:
"Located any singularities?" I asked 
Otacon.
"No, not yet," echoed Otacon's voice 
through the VR construct.
"Let me try a different setting. I'm 
getting ready. Hold on a minute."
I was left alone in the virtual reality.
"You must have figured out how to find 
singularities using VR, Snake. But you 
won't find one," boomed a voice 
suddenly from out of nowhere. It was 
Solidus.
I called Otacon.
"Otacon, it's Solidus."
"I know. I detected him from my end, 
too. He's hacking into the VR system, 
but he hasn't gotten full control yet. 
Let's hurry into the next VR construct. 
Are you ready?"
A new VR space spread in front of my 
eyes.#C0

"I detected a likely pattern. But it's too 
far away. Change the settings of your 
variables and aim for a higher score. 
Let's try again!"
I squared off. It looked like I had to get 
a higher score this time. The VR 
simulation began again.#C0

column2:
"We're getting a lot closer! I'll get 
ready for the next setting."
As soon as I nodded, I heard Mei Ling's
voice. "They're doing a lot better than 
we expected, aren't they?"
"Indeed. We'd better change our 
strategy. We're going to have to 
somehow block the singularity so they 
can't get any closer," answered 
Solidus' disembodied voice.
"How about using 'them'?"
"It's too dangerous. Even if they did 
stop Snake, it'd be pointless if the 
world was destroyed in the process."
"True enough."
"Using 'them' has to be our last resort."
"Everything is in your hands, honey."
Their voices were a lot clearer than 
before. They were definitely getting 
closer. I yelled to Otacon: "Otacon, it's 
Solidus!"
"I know. Their intrusion is progressing. 
We have to find the singularity before 
they get full control. Let's go!"#C0

column2:
"Otacon, have you sighted a 
singularity?" I asked from inside the 
VR.
"I'm picking up a reaction! Hurry to 
the next goal!"
"Honey! Snake is..."
I heard Mei Ling click her tongue. 
I heard it as if she was whispering to 
me. Solidus answered,
"I know. It may be time to use 'them.' 
Get ready." 
"Roger that."
I heard Otacon's excited voice. 
"Come in, Snake! Solidus has taken 
control of the VR system! We don't 
have much time. Let's begin!"#C0

column2:
There was nothing there. There was no 
light, no sound, no feeling of 
temperature or even of height. Was 
this the singularity? I called Otacon. 
But it was Solidus who answered.
"You're in what's called - how can I put 
this so you can understand it? - a gap 
between parallel universes."
"Solidus?! What are you trying to 
do?! Why are you trying to destroy 
the universe?!" I screamed.
"Destroy? Don't be stupid. This is a 
correction. Back to how things should 
be..."
"What do you mean?!"
"I don't know who created the 
Koppelthorn Engine, or where or when, 
or even why. But my guess is that it 
was designed as part of a grid 
computing system spread between the 
parallel universes."
Grid computing. I'd heard the term from
Otacon. It was a technique for creating 
a networked supercomputer with 
massive computational abilities by 
connecting numerous servers. If one 
could be built spanning across 
countless parallel universes, it would 
be possible to obtain near-limitless 
computing power.
"But when the universe-spanning 
Koppelthorn Engine was applied to the 
VR system, it became a device for 
controlling possibility itself." Solidus 
continued.
"Controlling?"
"That's correct. When a VR system 
using the Koppelthorn Engine is 
instructed to build a virtual reality 
having a given set of conditions, it 
selects a group of universes having the 
potential to satisfy those conditions from
among a still indefinite number of 
parallel universes that still have wave 
functions that have not converged. 
It then presents these as the VR 
construct you see before you. What you 
call VR training is nothing less than the 
external observation of and interference 
with that group of parallel universes!"
I recalled the bizarre sensation of 
possessing another person's body 
when I was engaged in VR training. 
I suppose that was the sensation of 
interfering with another universe. 
Solidus' voice echoed:
"When you go through VR training, 
your actions within virtual reality are 
reflected in a set of corresponding 
universes. The resulting interference 
simultaneously acts as observation with
regards to a group of still-indefinite 
parallel universes besides the one that 
is receiving the interference. That 
means that the possibilities of the 
universe converge on the conditions 
corresponding to the actions you took. 
For example, let's say you just killed an 
enemy soldier within the VR simulation. 
That means that the universe containing 
the killed soldier was observed and 
made definite. In other words, universes 
where that soldier had not been killed 
lose their indefinite potential and are 
erased from existence," Solidus 
continued.
"The only universe permitted to exist 
in the end is the one that doesn't 
contradict the actions you took in 
the VR simulation. Do you realize what 
this means? When your game is over 
in the VR system and you try again, 
the potential for existence for that very 
universe is denied and eliminated as 
never having existed. That means that 
every single time you replay the game, 
an uncounted number of universes are 
destroyed!"
I was in total shock.
"The disturbance of the parallel 
universes you've seen is a distortion 
generated by external interference. 
I suppose you could see it as the death 
cries of the universes that have been 
killed off. The singularities are a 
condensed form of that distortion."
I had a flashback of Olga, the 
Gurlugon, and Mei Ling. If this 
disturbance had really been caused by 
external interference, that meant...
"That means my own universe is 
receiving interference from VR systems 
in other universes?"
"Of course. Haven't you ever felt like 
your body wasn't your own, like you 
took an unexpected action after the 
fact? Or you were able to do 
something you didn't think was 
possible? That's because of 
interference from other universes. 
Perhaps the reason you were able to 
topple Shadow Moses is because of a 
helping hand from someone in another 
universe." Solidus' laugh echoed 
through the space.
"Through my research into parallel 
universes, I learned that I was killed 
many times in different worlds. 
I decided to protect my selves. I refuse 
to recognize any universe where I am 
killed! And that's why I decided to 
make things right with the VR system. 
I interfere with other parallel universes 
using the VR system and control them 
such that I won't die there. I don't care 
how much of a disturbance I create or 
how many contradictory universes are 
eliminated. The only thing that's 
important is my survival. Period."#C0

"That's crazy!"
"Do you really have the right to criticize
me? Haven't you refused to recognize 
your own failures within the VR 
simulation by retrying a level again?"#C0

column2:
Solidus laughed at my lack of a 
comeback.
"This conversation is over. I won't give 
up the singularity. And I can't let you 
restore the universes that I have 
corrected. So I'd like you to stay 
here... FOREVER!" He spat.
"You're going to regret forcing me to 
break the seal. 'They' will be here 
soon... a loathsome unit, infamous in 
uncountable universes, hated and 
feared by all. Their presence alone has 
the ability to destroy a world. They are 
children of darkness on whom is 
focused the combined hate of the 
entire universe. The princess of hell 
and the prince of chaos. Allow me to 
introduce... Rose and Jack!!" 
A dazzling light enveloped everything.#C0

column2:
"Jack! Earth to Jack!" Rose leaned 
over the table. She cocked her head 
and looked into my eyes.
"What's wrong? You looked out of it."
I gently stroked Rose's hair.
"Uh... I was enchanted by your eternal 
beauty."
"Very funny, Jack."
Rose became as bashful as a little girl.
"I'm being serious."
Rose touched my hand.
"Do you remember what day tomorrow 
is?"
"What, March 21st?"
"Yeah."
"Of course. It's the luckiest day of my 
entire life. The day I met you." I said.
"Wrong!"
"...Really?"
"Yep."
Rose puffed out her cheeks.
"I'm sorry. I think of how lucky I am to 
have met you every day, so I always 
think of the anniversary as being right 
around the corner."
"That doesn't exactly make sense, but 
I'm happy to hear it anyway," smiled 
Rose. "By the way, your mission this 
time is to defuse all bombs. Good luck."#C0

column2:
I'm smack in the middle of the 
battleground on a mission. The roar of 
cannons and gunfire punctuate the 
darkness. Conditions are unbelievably 
harsh this time around. No one on 
either side is without injury, and the 
bodies of the dead lie sprawled 
everywhere. It's hell on Earth. 
I instinctively duck, feeling a bullet cut 
through the air inches away. Just then, 
the Codec rings. It's Rose. 
"Do you want to.... Jack? What 
happened to the mission?"
"I'm in the middle of it!"
"Oh, that's right."
"What is it?"
Rose hesitated for a moment before 
she spoke.
"...Jack, I need to talk."
"Talk?"
"Yes, it's very important. And we'll talk 
about it,tomorrow."
Why is she telling me now about 
something she wants to discuss 
tomorrow? Confused, I put the 
question to her:
"Why not now?"
Rose eagerly said:
"All right, I'll tell you. Jack... I'm... 
I'm carrying..."
A heavy silence filled the air. Finally, 
Rose seemed to make up her mind.
"...I think I'm gaining weight! I'm 
getting love handles. What should I 
do?"
"What should you...? I didn't notice at 
all!"
"Really? But my old skirt is getting 
kind of tight on me...."
"If it really bothers you that much, why 
don't you start working out? I'll even 
join you if you like."
"That's great! How about jogging? 
Oh, before I forget, your mission this 
time is to hold up all enemies and get 
to the goal. Good luck."#C0

column2:
Rose and I were having dinner at a 
riverside restaurant. Rose was beautiful 
this night, as usual. A bit of wine had 
made her already cute cheeks all rosy. 
Just as the main dish was being served,
the Colonel ran up to the table.
"Raiden, something happened to me 
last Thursday...."
"Colonel! What's wrong? Were you 
abducted by aliens again?" 
The Colonel became upset.
"Aliens?! What the hell-- There's no 
such thing as aliens! I highly 
disapprove."
"What is it, then?"
Making a visible effort to calm himself, 
the Colonel began his story.
"Listen carefully. There's a barley field 
behind my house. Thursday night, 
I saw something - many things - flashing
in there. When I went into the field the 
next morning, I discovered that the 
stalks of barley had been flattened into 
huge circular patterns. They were very 
complex.... What do you think?"
"Huh?"
I was at a loss for words, but Rose 
answered on my behalf.
"You know, I think it's some kind of a 
message."
The Colonel said in a shaky voice:
"I... I thought so. I guess I'll need some
scissors, then.... Anyway, your mission 
this time is to destroy all targets and 
head to the goal. Stay focused."#C0

column2:
Rose and I were taking a walk in the 
park early one afternoon. The sunlight 
filtered down through the treetops. 
We walked to a pond and sat down on 
a bench. As I put my arm around Rose,
somebody jumped out of the pond with 
an odd squeal. It was Vamp! Pulling 
out a knife, he threw it directly at us. 
Protecting Rose with my body, I drew 
my gun and shot down the knife. 
I continued firing. A bullet struck Vamp 
between the eyes, knocking him to the 
ground. But groaning slightly, he stood 
back up again. I heard Rose's trembling
voice.
"I don't believe it.... How...?"
Licking a trickle of his blood with his 
long tongue, Vamp replied:
"I died once already, I can't die twice."
Rose nodded.
"Well, I guess it can't be helped, then." 
Squealing again, Vamp lunged toward 
the pond. Landing directly on the 
pond's surface, he ran across while 
yelling: 
"Your mission this time is to take out 
all enemies and get to the goal! 
Go, NOW!"#C0

column2:
Rose and I were watching a monster 
movie in her bedroom. Suddenly, the 
screen filled with static.
"Is it broken?"
When I got up from the bed, the 
static-filled television screen began to 
speak.
"Raiden, are you receiving? We're still 
here."
"The La-li-lu-le-lo?!" said Rose, in 
shock. The La-li-lu-le-lo continued:
"Raiden. You want to know who we 
are, don't you?" 
I jumped from the bed in surprise. 
The La-li-lu-le-lo let out something 
approximating a laugh.
"Heh, heh, heh. As you already know, 
we're not what you'd call -- human. 
But you know what? Toilets get all 
kinds of stains: dried urine, yellow 
stains, water stains.... They need 
constant cleaning. Don't you agree?"
"What are you talking about?!"
Just then, I heard another voice from 
the radio, in spite of it being turned off.
"Raiden, are you receiving? We're still 
here."
"Ta-ti-tu-te-to! Jack! It's the 
Ta-ti-tu-te-to!" shrieked Rose.
The Ta-ti-tu-te-to said,
"Heh, heh, heh. We have some advice 
for you about those yellow stains. 
First, lay some toilet paper over the 
stain. Then sprinkle on the detergent. 
Let it sit for a few minutes, and then 
scrub hard... with the paper." 
"What the--?!"
As soon as the words left my mouth, 
the answering machine began to speak.
"Raiden, are you receiving? We're still 
here."
"I-ro-ha-ni-ho-he-to?! Oh, no, Jack! 
What should we do?!"
Rose held on to my arm. I held her as 
she trembled. The I-ro-ha-ni-ho-he-to 
said,
"Make sure to pay attention to the rim, 
inside the toilet. The urine sprays onto 
it."
The La-li-lu-le-lo jumped in.
"Wear rubber gloves, and use a sponge
or a piece of cloth to rub dirty spots 
you can't reach with a brush."
The Ta-ti-tu-te-to continued.
"It wouldn't be a bad idea to use an old
toothbrush."
The I-ro-ha-ni-ho-he-to spoke up.
"Don't forget to wipe the outside of the 
toilet or the floor, either. If you leave 
any urine stains behind, it'll smell later."
I yelled a question.
"What in the hell does this have to do 
with who you are?!"
"NOTHING!!!" La-li-lu-le-lo yelled 
back. I was floored.
"Uh, so... what's your point, then?"
The three of them answered at the 
same time.
"Heh, heh, heh.... Our point is very 
simple."
The La-li-lu-le-lo said:
"This time..."
Ta-ti-tu-te-to said:
"...your..."
The I-ro-ha-ni-ho-he-to said:
"...mission is..."
Rose said:
"...to get to the goal without being 
discovered. Good luck!"#C0

control of the VR from Solidus! I'm 
going to release you now!"#C0
column3:
"Snake, are you okay!? I took back

column2:
I was enveloped in an overpoweringly 
bright light. The next moment, I was 
thrown into a huge space with a 
mysteriously lit floor surface. I could 
hear Otacon's voice.
"Snake! Snake!! Are you okay?!"
I shook my head to clear a mild 
headache. It felt like I'd been dreaming 
for a long time. 
"I've completely retaken control of the 
VR system from Solidus!" said Otacon
excitedly.
"That's good. So where's the 
singularity...?"
"I've found it! It's there! You're in the 
singularity! Now we can start returning 
the universe to normal!" 
Just then, I felt something huge closing 
in from the front. A Metal Gear RAY 
emerged from the darkness. Then a 
second one, then more, right after the 
others. Otacon screamed:
"It's Solidus' final attempt to stop us! 
I need a little more time to finish things 
on my end. Just hold on for a little bit!"
The Metal Gear RAY units closed in. 
I squared off against them. I'd have to 
fight until Otacon finished his work.#C0

column2:
When I came to, I once again found 
myself in what Solidus had called the 
gap between the parallel universes. 
I heard Otacon's happy voice from 
somewhere.
"Snake! We did it! Everything went 
perfectly on my end! Space has begun 
to repair itself!"
"Exactly like it was before?" I spoke to
thin air.
"Should be. You should be pulled into 
our universe soon. But it looks like the 
repairs are occurring sequentially. 
It could be some time before everything
goes back to normal...."
"SNAKE!!" echoed Solidus' angry 
voice.
There was a flash of light, and when 
I opened my eyes I found myself 
standing atop the destroyed Federal 
Hall along with Solidus. Solidus drew 
his swords. I said:
"Just stop! It's over. The universe is 
repairing itself."
"No, it's not over. If I manage to kill 
you here, at least one universe where 
I survive will be made definite!"
"Stop it! There has to be another way!
I'm returning to my universe. I have no 
intention of interfering with yours. 
There's no reason for us to fight!!"
But Solidus merely laughed at my 
words, readying his swords. He fixed 
me with a piercing, menacing stare. 
"Enough talk! FIGHT ME!!"#C0

Hall. I threw my hand out for him, but 
caught nothing but air. Solidus' body fell 
in silence. I couldn't do anything but 
watch. The moment his body hit the 
ground, I was enveloped in a blindingly 
powerful light.#C0

column2:
When the light cleared, I found myself 
in the hideout. Otacon and Olga stood 
right in front of me. Otacon raised his 
hand.
"Hi. Welcome back, Snake."
"Your return could mean that I'll be 
next to go," said Olga.
"We'll miss you."
Olga smiled gently.
"I'll miss you, too. But I have to go. 
There's somebody I want to see."
"Your kid?"
Olga looked at me in surprise.
"What? I don't have any children.... 
not yet."
She lowered her eyes as if 
embarrassed and said, 
"My husband is waiting for me."
"H-Husband?!" Otacon and I 
exclaimed in shock.
"That's right. In my universe..."
I quickly interrupted her.
"No. We'd probably be better off not 
knowing."
Olga smiled broadly. A bright light 
enveloped her body, and she was gone.
Otacon said sadly:
"She's gone."
"Yeah."
"...But now that I think of it, the Snake 
standing in front of me seems different 
from the Snake I know from my 
universe...."
It was just as Otacon said. In an 
uncountable number of parallel 
universes, there had to be some that 
were incredibly similar. We hadn't felt 
anything out of the ordinary, but it was 
possible that the Otacon in front of me 
was a millimeter taller than the Otacon I 
knew. Or maybe he didn't like dogs. 
Perhaps his father was still alive. 
The memories we thought we shared 
might have been erased from existence.
But there was no way to check for sure.
As I stood engrossed in thought, 
Otacon extended an open palm.
"... The Snake in my universe owes me 
a hundred bucks."
Ignoring him, I said:
"The Otacon from my universe wouldn't 
be angry even if I told him I accidentally
broke one of his action figure toys."
Otacon's eyes widened in shock.
"What?! Which one did you break?!"
I let out a laugh. Soon both of us were 
laughing. We realized something. 
We might not have the same shared 
memories. And perhaps we'd be going 
to different universes shortly. But one 
thing was clear. We were friends.
The world filled with bright light.
Otacon and I shook hands.#C0

column2:
When I came to, I was sitting in a chair 
in the hideout. I looked around the 
room. It was the same hideout as ever. 
There was no trace of the damage 
Solidus had caused. Had I returned to 
just before the whole incident even 
happened? My path of vision crossed 
with Otacon, who was sitting across 
from me.
"Did we come back?" asked Otacon.
Judging from his tone of voice, it 
seemed he'd been through a similar 
experience to mine. But there had to be 
an uncountable number of universes 
where nearly the same thing had 
occurred. I didn't know if this Otacon 
had been in the same universe with me, 
and there was no way to check. But I 
didn't really care. The person sitting in 
front of me was Otacon.
"It's all over..." said Otacon, stretching.
Something occurred to me, and I said: 
"Are you sure?"
"What do you mean?"
"...I just wonder if it's really over yet."
I told Otacon about what I couldn't get 
out of my head. When I faced Solidus 
at the end, I really hadn't wanted to 
fight him. But I did fight, and I killed 
him. It was as if I hadn't been in control 
of my own body.... Solidus said the 
Koppelthorn Engine and the VR system 
interfered with the parallel universes, 
but what if he was wrong? Or what if 
there was another device that allowed 
one to externally observe and interfere 
with a parallel universe...?
"You're thinking too much," Otacon 
said, laughing it off. "And anyway..."
He leaned towards me.
"Did you say you broke one of my 
action figures?!"
"No, I was just..."
Suddenly the door opened, and in 
walked Mei Ling. She looked like 
nothing had happened to her at all.
"Hey, check this out!"
Mei Ling threw us the tabloid she'd 
brought with her.#C0
column3:
When I came to, I was sitting in a chair 
in the hideout. I looked around the 
room. It was the same hideout as ever. 
There was no trace of the damage 
Solidus had caused. Had I returned to 
just before the whole incident even 
happened? My path of vision crossed 
with Otacon, who was sitting across 
from me.
"Did we come back?" asked Otacon.
Judging from his tone of voice, it 
seemed he'd been through a similar 
experience to mine. But there had to be 
an uncountable number of universes 
where nearly the same thing had 
occurred. I didn't know if this Otacon 
had been in the same universe with me, 
and there was no way to check. But I 
didn't really care. The person sitting in 
front of me was Otacon.
"It's all over..." said Otacon, stretching.
Something occurred to me, and I said: 
"Are you sure?"
"What do you mean?"
"...I just wonder if it's really over yet."
I told Otacon about what I couldn't get 
out of my head. When I faced Solidus 
at the end, I really hadn't wanted to 
fight him. But I did fight, and I killed 
him. It was as if I hadn't been in control 
of my own body.... Solidus said the 
Koppelthorn Engine and the VR system 
interfered with the parallel universes, 
but what if he was wrong? Or what if 
there was another device that allowed 
one to externally observe and interfere 
with a parallel universe...?
"You're thinking too much," Otacon 
said, laughing it off. "And anyway..."
He leaned towards me.
"Did you say you broke one of my 
action figures?!"
"No, I was just..."
Suddenly the door opened, and in 
walked Mei Ling. She looked like 
nothing had happened to her at all.
"Hey, check this out!"
Mei Ling threw us the tabloid she'd 
brought with her.#C0

column2:
J'ouvris la porte donnant sur l'Etai B. Je me
rendis sur la passerelle AB. Pas d'ennemi 
l'horizon. Otacon me donna des instructions
par Codec.
"Ecoute bien, Snake. Je vais rpter. Cette
fois, notre cible c'est ce mystrieux monstre
non identifi dont tout le monde parle. Ils
l'appellent le Gurlugon."
Qu'est-ce qu'il voulait dire ? Les seuls 
parler du Gurlugon et  en faire tout un plat,
c'taient Otacon et Mei Ling. En tout cas,
c'est ce que je pensais. Mais je ne dis rien.
Otacon continua.
"Tu le sais srement dj, mais surtout NE
LE BLESSE PAS ! Prends une photo de lui
avant qu'il ne disparaisse. Tu t'en es bien
tir jusqu'ici, alors, pas de btise !"
J'avais les mains lies. Ridicule ou pas, une
mission est une mission. Je me dcidai et
commenai  traverser la passerelle de
connexion AB.#C0

column2:
J'approuvai sans conviction. Tout fier,
Otacon demanda :
"Que penses-tu du nouveau systme de
RV ?"
"Pas mal."
"C'est tout ?" Mcontent, il tourna la tte.
"En fait, je n'en reviens pas. Je ne pensais
pas que a marcherait si bien."
"Je sais ! Le systme de RV est quip
d'un moteur de Koppelthorn. Je l'ai install
l'autre jour."
"Un moteur de Koppelthorn ?"
En entendant la question, Otacon ta ses
lunettes avec un sourire aux lvres.
"Le moteur de Koppelthorn est un systme
de calcul quantique qui a suscit pas mal
d'intrt dernirement. Tu t'y connais en
calcul quantique, pas vrai ?" commena
Otacon.
Il n'en finissait plus, des machins  q 
par-ci et des trucs Tensor par-l. Pendant
deux heures trente-sept minutes, je regrettai
amrement ma question.
"... Pour rsumer, il permet de construire
des environnements de ralit virtuelle
renfermant une quantit d'informations
jamais obtenue jusqu'alors. Les informations
sont converties en signaux envoys au
cerveau par le casque et directement
synthtiss pour chaque sens. Les ractions
de ton corps sont limines. Ainsi, il est
possible de crer un environnement de RV
totalement indiscernable du monde rel tant
au niveau des lumires, des sons que de
l'odorat et du toucher."
Il reprit son souffle. Je n'allais pas rater
l'occasion.
"Je vois. Je comprends maintenant..." dis-je
en essayant de quitter mon sige. Mais il
me retint.
"Attends un peu. Ressayons. Le scnario
suivant consiste  liminer les ennemis pour
que les otages puissent s'enfuir de la Big
Shell."
Otacon devait avoir hte d'essayer son
nouveau jouet. Je me rassis  contrecur.
Il continua son briefing.
"Ta mission consiste  liminer tous les
ennemis dans un certain dlai. Prt ? On y
va !"
Je remis le casque et fermai les yeux. Un
clat de lumire m'aveugla. Tout de suite
aprs, je me retrouvai dans un monde qui,
j'avais du mal  le croire, n'tait rien d'autre
qu'une simulation.#C0

column2:
La simulation en RV se termina. La ralit
virtuelle qui aurait facilement pu passer pour
la  vraie ralit  disparut et je revins 
moi. J'enlevai le casque. "Alors ?"
demanda Otacon. Je lui fis part de mes
impressions sur les deux essais. "C'est bien
fait, c'est sr. Mais il y a quelque chose de
pas naturel, au niveau des sens, je dirais."
"Comment a pas naturel ?"
"C'est dur  dcrire mais... c'est comme si
j'avais le corps de quelqu'un d'autre..."
"C'est  cause du pseudo-signal qui remplit
le cerveau. En thorie, il doit tre possible
de reproduire exactement le mme stimulus
qu' partir des structures sensorielles du
corps physique."
Au beau milieu de ma conversation avec
Otacon, la porte s'ouvrit et Mei Ling entra.
"H, regardez a !"
Mei Ling nous lana le journal qu'elle avait
apport.#C0

column2:
L'article dcrivait l'apparition d'une norme
crature prs de la Big Shell. Le titre disait :
 Un monstre  la Big Shell !? 
Compltement ridicule. "Et alors ?" dis-je
sans hsiter. Mei Ling cligna des yeux avec
surprise.
"Et alors !? C'est un monstre, Snake !"
Otacon frappa sur la table.
"C'est vrai ! C'est un monstre !"
"La photo est srement truque." C'tait une
opinion tout ce qu'il y a de plus normal,
mais le regard qu'ils me lancrent m'en fit
douter. Pour finir, ils dcidrent de
m'ignorer.
"a parat incroyable, n'est-ce pas, Mei Ling
? Un monstre  New York ? C'est inou !"
"Exactement ! C'est inou ! Trop inou !!"
"Donc, c'est  la Big Shell. Je veux y
aller..."
"H, Otacon, j'ai une ide. Et si on capturait
le monstre ? Qu'en dis-tu ?"
"Gnial ! Capturons-le ! a rendrait un
grand service  la biologie. Non,  TOUTES
les sciences !"
"C'est vrai ! H, tu crois qu'on aurait
beaucoup de clients si on construisait un
zoo de monstres ?"
"Bien sr ! A en juger par sa nageoire
dorsale, il doit venir des profondeurs...
Qu'en penses-tu ?"
"Peut-tre. Que dirais-tu d'animaux
empaills ou de T-shirts ?"
"Pas mal ! Mais c'est peut-tre un
messager venu de l'espace, tu vois ce que
je veux dire ?"
"Tout  fait. Mais on devrait d'abord dposer
notre marque."
Ils poursuivirent avec enthousiasme leur
conversation incohrente. Je ne pouvais pas
croire qu'ils y songeaient srieusement mais
il fallait que je leur demande.
"H, vous ne songez pas srieusement 
capturer cette chose..."
Otacon me regarda d'un air choqu.
"Rveille-toi, Snake ! On est en train de
parler d'un monstre !"
Mei Ling tapa sur une chaise.
"Il a raison ! Il s'agit d'un monstre !"
"Mais..."
Otacon se pencha vers moi. "Un monstre
d'origine inconnue est apparu ! En tant que
scientifique, je dois agir !"
"Dois-je te rappeler la situation financire de
Philanthropy !? On ne sait mme pas si on
pourra payer le loyer ce mois-ci !" rpliqua
Mei Ling d'un ton sec, le regard menaant.
"Mais..."
"Qu'est-ce que tu proposes au lieu de le
capturer !?"
"Vas-tu laisser cette occasion te filer entre
les mains !? Espce de lche !"
"Mais, mais..."
Tandis que j'hsitais, Otacon et Mei Ling
poursuivirent leur tirade.
"Il faut qu'on le fasse !"
"Il faut qu'on le fasse !"
A ce stade, je ne pouvais plus que dire
 d'accord .

Voil comment j'atterris sur la Big Shell.
C'tait il y avait trois heures.#C0

column2:
En entrant dans l'Etai C, je contactai Otacon
par Codec. "Alors, Snake ? Des indices ?"
demanda Otacon.
"Ngatif. Mais j'ai vu des gens bizarres
traner dans le coin."
Je lui dis que j'avais vu des soldats sur la
passerelle de connexion CD. Il rpondit :
"Je parie qu'ils essaient d'attraper le
Gurlugon, eux aussi."
"J'en doute..."
"C'est certain !" lana-t-il sr de lui.
"Quoi qu'il en soit, poursuis tes recherches
sans te faire prendre. Le Gurlugon a t
aperu au sud-ouest de la Big Shell surtout.
Va sur la passerelle AB."
Aprs avoir fait tout ce chemin, je ne
pouvais qu'obir  Otacon. Je commenai 
me diriger vers la passerelle AB.#C0

column2:
"Laissez-moi passer !" s'cria Olga.
Elle n'tait pas arme. Elle ne semblait pas
vouloir attaquer. Je me mis  lui parler tout
en rengainant mon pistolet.
"Qu'est-ce que tu fais ici ?"
Olga sourit lgrement, mais d'un sourire
bizarre. Elle avait l'air si diffrente. Elle ne
laissait plus cette impression de tragdie et
de sombre grandeur que je lui connaissais.
On aurait dit une autre femme.
"Garde tes distances. Je ne suis pas le moi
que tu connais et je ne connais pas le moi
que tu connais."
"Qu'est-ce que tu racontes ?"
"Je cherche la cl pour repartir dans mon
univers et cette trange crature est cette
cl. Elle n'appartient pas  ton univers. Moi
non plus. Nous venons d'ailleurs. Et ton
univers va avoir des ennuis si tu n'y prends
garde !"
Je n'arrivais pas  comprendre l'histoire
d'Olga. J'tais perdu. Tout en grinant des
dents, elle dirigea son regard vers la mer.
"Mince. Il s'en va. Ecoute ! Vrifie le
systme de RV ! Il permet de jeter un il
dans un autre univers. C'est ce qui cause
tous ces problmes !" s'cria Olga en
sautant de la passerelle.
"Attends !"
Je me penchai par dessus la rambarde,
mais elle avait dj disparu dans l'eau. L'un
aprs l'autre, ses acolytes sautrent dans la
mer.
Je me retrouvai seul sur la passerelle. Je ne
voyais plus le Gurlugon.#C0

column2:
Ma photo du Gurlugon trnait sur la table, 
la cachette. "Rien aujourd'hui ?" dis-je 
Mei Ling.
"Non. Aujourd'hui encore, il a dcid de se
cacher."
Pas de Gurlugon depuis une semaine.
Personne ne savait o il apparatrait la
prochaine fois. Peut-tre qu'il ne se
montrerait plus jamais.
|
Je croyais Olga. Elle n'avait pas l'air de
mentir et, de plus, l'existence de ce monstre
ridicule en tait la preuve. Une telle crature
ne pouvait pas vivre dans notre monde,
mais c'tait peut-tre possible dans un autre
monde. |
|
Otacon avana une thorie sur les  univers
parallles .
Comme toujours, Otacon donna plus
d'explications que je n'en voulais. En un
mot, il n'y avait probablement pas un
univers unique, mais une multitude d'univers
existant en parallle. Il pouvait donc exister
un univers exactement identique au mien, 
un cheveu prs. Dans un autre univers, la
civilisation pouvait tre ne des paramcies.
Il pouvait mme y avoir un univers rempli de
monstres. D'aprs Otacon, ces univers
taient censs s'exclure mutuellement mais,
sans qu'on sache pourquoi, ils avaient
commenc  s'entrecroiser au hasard. C'est
ainsi que notre Olga avait t remplace par
une Olga d'un univers parallle et que ce
monstre s'tait retrouv dans le ntre. Et il
semblait que le phnomne progressait.
|
Mais si sa thorie tait correcte, nous
allions avoir de gros ennuis. Par exemple, il
se pouvait que je sois remplac par une
autre version de moi-mme venant d'un
autre univers. Otacon avait peut-tre dj
t remplac par un autre Otacon. Et si
nous passions dans un univers o la lune
est sur le point d'entrer en collision avec la

Otacon eut l'air cur. Il m'expliqua que le
moteur de Koppelthorn qui tait au cur du
nouveau systme de RV tait un dispositif
de calcul quantique conu par le Dr.
Koppelthorn, mais que ses principes
demeuraient inconnus. Il ouvrit le botier
noir, mais ne trouva rien de plus que des
circuits mystrieux, des engrenages
bruyants et ce qui ressemblait  des
sphres en fer. Pourtant, a marchait. C'est
srement pour cela que certaines personnes
s'y intressaient tant. Des amateurs
pseudo-scientifiques l'avaient examin mais

civilisation disparue. Bref, personne ne
savait comment a marchait. Et personne
n'avait jamais vu le Dr. Koppelthorn en
personne.
|

parallles ? Olga avait dit que la cause du

galement franchir le mur sparant les

vrai, il fallait l'liminer pour arrter la
distorsion.

chercher le Gurlugon. Nous avions perdu

aucun progrs dans l'analyse du systme de

parallles se poursuivait peut-tre. Il se
pouvait mme que certains des univers
soient en pril. Et il se pouvait aussi que
notre univers suive la mme voie quelques
instants plus tard. Nous tions totalement
reints.

interfrer avec d'autres univers parallles,

peut-tre le vrai et celui de notre univers
disparatrait..."
"Ce n'est pas un peu pouss ?" objecta
Otacon.

"On ne peut pas rester assis  regarder
cette photo ! Il faut faire quelque chose !
Tu n'es pas d'accord, Snake !?"

encore trouv de solution au problme.

Gurlugon dans le systme de RV.#C0

column2:
Une fois le Gurlugon vaincu, nous
teignmes le systme de RV. Mais je
n'tais pas encore convaincu. J'tai le
casque et dis  Otacon :
"Tu crois qu'on a vraiment russi ?"
Otacon haussa les paules. Il devait tre de
mon avis.
Mei Ling dit alors :
"Bien sr que la mission a russi."
Elle sourit d'un air narquois.
"On vient de perdre le seul moyen de
rtablir les univers parallles."
"Qu'est-ce que tu dis !?" dis-je, en me
levant de mon sige. Mei Ling rpondit :
"Il ne fait aucun doute que le Gurlugon tait
la particularit reprsentant la dformation
des univers parallles. Or, le seul moyen de
ramener l'espace  la normale n'est pas de
dtruire la particularit, mais de la capturer,
d'effectuer une conversion contre-unitaire 
l'aide du moteur de Koppelthorn, en
ramenant la fonction d'onde  son tat
pr-convergence..."
Mei Ling continua, la voix pleine de
satisfaction.
"Bref, liminer la particularit, c'est aussi
liminer le seul moyen de ramener l'espace
 la normale."
"Qui es-tu !?"
Mei Ling se moqua d'Otacon.
"Comme dirait Olga, je ne suis pas la Mei
Ling que vous connaissez. Mais ne m'en
voulez pas trop : je suivais juste les ordres
de quelqu'un."
"Quelqu'un ? Qui ?" lui demandai-je.
"Mon mari," rpondit Mei Ling avec douceur.
"Je crois qu'il s'appelle Solidus dans votre
univers."
Nous hurlmes sans rflchir. "Solidus !?"
Mei Ling montra un mur du doigt et dit :
"Quand on parle du loup..."
A ce moment-l, le mur explosa. Des dbris
jaillirent du trou. Il y avait de la poussire
partout. Solidus Snake, dans sa
combinaison motorise, se tenait l. Il dit 
Mei Ling : "Je t'ai fait attendre, hein ?"
"Mon chri !"
Mei Ling se jeta dans les bras de Solidus.
Je me prcipitai sur Solidus. Il lana un
missile de sa main de serpent. Une lueur
aveuglante. Une explosion. Je fus projet
contre le mur et je perdis connaissance.
Lorsque je revins  moi, je vis Solidus serrer
Mei Ling dans ses bras et s'enfuir par le
trou qu'il venait de faire dans le mur.#C0

column2:
"Alors, quel talent avez-vous ?" demanda
Otacon. Une ravissante femme noire tait
assise en face de nous. Elle tait trop gaie.
Elle riait trop.
"Je suis vraiment chanceuse !"
"Chanceuse !? C'est un talent ?"
"Et comment !"
Plutt perplexe, je regardai Otacon
continuer de questionner la candidate.
Otacon avait publi une annonce dans le
principal journal de la ville :  Recrutons des
membres pour l'quipe de recherche du
Gurlugon ! Attrapons le monstre
mystrieux ! Nous avons des informations
crdibles concernant les endroits o il
apparatra. Exprience apprcie. Dtails
 voir lors de l'entretien... 
Pas mal de gens se prsentrent, ce qui
nous surprit. Nous avions dj vu plus de
dix candidats, mais toujours pas d'Olga.
"Nous vous contacterons."
"J'attends votre rponse !"
La femme se leva, lui fit un grand sourire et
partit. Je dis  Otacon : "Tu crois vraiment
que a va marcher !?"
"Elle aussi cherche srement des
informations sur le Gurlugon. Elle viendra."
"Mais on n'a vu que des gens bizarres !
Comme ce vieil homme expert en sauts
arrires et en glissades et..."
"Ouais, il tait marrant !"
"H !"
De toute vidence, Otacon prenait un
certain plaisir  tout a.
"Pas de panique. Attendons encore un peu.
Au suivant !" cria Otacon. La porte s'ouvrit.
Et voil qu'entra Olga.#C0

De retour dans les ruines de notre cachette,
nous expliqumes la situation  Olga. Aprs
avoir cout, elle dit qu'il restait encore une
solution. "Il est vrai que la particularit du
Gurlugon peut avoir t limine mais a ne
veut pas dire que toutes les particularits de
tous les univers parallles l'aient t."
Une lueur d'espoir traversa les yeux
d'Otacon.
"Tu veux dire qu'il y a d'autres
particularits ?"
"Srement. Mais sous quelle forme et  quel
endroit, j'ignore. Elles seront difficiles 
trouver."
"On a des donnes sur le Gurlugon.
Si nous analysons son comportement
et tudions son environnement avec
la RV, peut-tre que..."
Otacon et Olga continurent leur
conversation technique. Pour finir, ils
optrent pour une mthode visant  trouver
les particularits d'autres univers parallles
en rglant de faon continue et prcise le
paramtre de fonction d'onde du systme de
RV afin d'imiter le comportement unique
d'une particularit. Bref, il semblait que
j'allais devoir affronter une srie de
constructions de RV. Les prparations furent
trs rapides. Je retournai au sige du
systme de RV. Otacon dit : "Je te prviens
ds que je repre une particularit. En
attendant, continue  franchir les tapes de
RV. Fais attention, car Solidus va srement
ragir. Il y aura peut-tre des piges.
Prudence !"
Otacon dmarra le systme de RV. La
ralit virtuelle se dploya devant moi.#C0

"C'est mieux ! Je me prpare pour le
rglage suivant."
A peine avais-je hoch la tte que j'entendis
Mei Ling. "Ils s'en sortent bien mieux qu'on
ne le pensait, non ?"
"C'est vrai. On ferait mieux de changer de
stratgie. Il va falloir bloquer la particularit
pour les empcher de s'en approcher,"
rpondit la voix dsincarne de Solidus.
"Et si on se servait d'eux ?"
"C'est trop risqu. Mme s'ils parviennent 
arrter Snake, ce serait inutile si a entrane
la destruction du monde."
"C'est vrai."
"On les utilisera en dernier recours
seulement."
"C'est toi qui vois, mon chri."
Leurs voix taient bien plus nettes qu'avant.
Pas de doute, ils se rapprochaient.
"Otacon, c'est Solidus !" hurlai-je. "Je sais.
Leur intrusion progresse. Il faut trouver la
particularit avant qu'ils ne contrlent tout.
Allons-y !"#C0

column2:
Il n'y avait rien. Pas de lumire, pas de son,
pas de sensation de temprature ni mme
de hauteur. Etait-ce a, la particularit ?
J'appelai Otacon mais ce fut Solidus qui
rpondit.
"Tu es dans ce qu'on appelle - comment
dire ? - un vide entre les univers
parallles."
"Solidus !? Qu'est-ce que tu essaies de
faire !? Pourquoi veux-tu dtruire l'univers
!?" criai-je.
"Dtruire ? Ne sois pas stupide. J'opre
une correction. Un retour  la normale..."
"Que veux-tu dire !?"
"Je ne sais pas qui a cr le moteur de
Koppelthorn, ni o ni quand, ni mme
pourquoi, mais je crois qu'il fait partie
intgrante d'un systme de calcul distribu
s'tendant entre les univers parallles."
Le calcul distribu. Otacon en avait parl.
Cette technique permettait, par la connexion
de multiples serveurs, de crer un
super-ordinateur en rseau aux capacits de
calcul normes. Si on pouvait en construire
un s'tendant sur d'innombrables univers, on
pourrait obtenir une puissance de calcul
presque illimite.
"Mais, une fois appliqu au systme de RV,
ce moteur de Koppelthorn s'est transform
en dispositif capable de contrler la
possibilit mme," continua Solidus.
"Contrler ?"
"Exact. Quand on ordonne  un systme de
RV dot du moteur de Koppelthorn de
construire une ralit virtuelle rpondant 
certains critres, il slectionne un groupe
d'univers pouvant rpondre  ces critres
parmi un ensemble d'univers parallles
encore indfinis et ayant encore des
fonctions d'onde n'ayant pas converg, puis
il les prsente sous la forme de la
construction RV que tu vois devant toi. La
formation en RV n'est que l'observation
externe de ce groupe d'univers parallles et
l'interfrence avec lui !"
Je me souvins d'avoir prouv la sensation
bizarre d'avoir le corps de quelqu'un d'autre
lors de ma formation en RV. Elle tait
srement due  l'interfrence avec un autre
univers. La voix de Solidus rsonna :
"Pendant la formation en RV, les actions
effectues dans la ralit virtuelle se
refltent dans un ensemble d'univers
correspondants. L'interfrence rsultante
agit simultanment comme observation d'un
groupe d'univers parallles encore indfinis
en plus de celui qui reoit l'interfrence.
Cela veut dire que les possibilits de
l'univers convergent selon les conditions qui
correspondent  tes actions. Par exemple,
supposons que tu viennes de tuer un soldat
ennemi dans la simulation de RV. Cela
signifie que l'univers contenant le soldat tu
a t observ et dfini. En d'autres termes,
les univers ayant d'autres possibilits, bref
les univers parallles o ce soldat n'a pas
t tu, perdent leur potentiel indfini et
sont effacs."
Solidus continua.
"En fait, les seuls univers autoriss  exister
sont ceux qui ne contredisent pas les
actions effectues dans la simulation de RV.
Tu comprends ? Lorsque ta partie se
termine dans le systme de RV et que tu
recommences, la possibilit d'existence de
cet univers est refuse et limine comme
si elle n'avait jamais exist. Cela veut dire
qu' chaque fois que tu recommences une
partie, d'innombrables univers sont
dtruits !"
J'tais sidr.
"La perturbation des univers parallles 
laquelle tu as assist est une distorsion due
 une interfrence externe. On pourrait la
comparer aux cris de mort des univers ayant
t tus. Les particularits sont une forme
condense de cette distorsion."
Je revis Olga, le Gurlugon et Mei Ling. Si
cette perturbation avait vraiment t cause
par une interfrence externe, cela
signifiait...
"Cela signifie que mon propre univers reoit
des interfrences de systmes de RV
d'autres univers ? "
"Evidemment. Tu n'as jamais ressenti que
ton corps ne t'appartenait pas, que tu avais
agi d'une faon surprenante ? Ou que tu
tais capable de faire quelque chose que tu
croyais impossible ? C'est  cause des
interfrences d'autres univers. C'est peut-
tre parce que quelqu'un d'un autre univers
t'a aid que tu es sorti victorieux de Shadow
Moses." Le rire de Solidus retentit dans
l'espace.
"Au cours de mes recherches sur les
univers parallles, j'ai appris que j'avais t
tu plusieurs fois dans des mondes
diffrents. J'ai dcid de protger mes
diffrents  moi . Je refuse de reconnatre
les univers o j'ai t tu ! C'est pourquoi
j'ai dcid de changer les choses avec le
systme de RV. Grce  lui, j'interfre avec
d'autres univers parallles et je les contrle
pour ne pas y mourir. Qu'importe si cela
cause des perturbations ou si cela limine
des univers contradictoires. Ce qui compte,
c'est ma survie. Point."#C0

 la particularit. Et je ne peux te laisser

column2:
"Jack ! Ici la terre, Jack !" Rose se
pencha sur la table. Elle tourna la tte et
me regarda dans les yeux.
"a ne va pas ? Tu avais l'air ailleurs."
Je caressai ses cheveux.
"Heu... j'tais sous le charme de ton
ternelle beaut."
"Trs drle, Jack."
Rose se sentit rougir comme une petite fille.
"Je suis srieux."
Rose me toucha la main.
"Tu sais quel jour on est demain ?
"Quoi, le 21 mars ?"
"Oui."
"Bien sr. C'est le plus beau jour de ma vie.
Le jour o je t'ai rencontre," dis-je.
"Faux !"
"... Vraiment ?"
"Oui."
Rose souffla.
"Dsol. Tous les jours je me dis que j'ai de
la chance de t'avoir rencontre, alors je
crois toujours que notre anniversaire n'est
pas loin."
"a ne veut rien dire mais a me fait plaisir
quand mme," dit Rose. "Au fait, cette fois
ta mission consiste  dsamorcer toutes les
bombes. Bonne chance."#C0

column2:
J'tais en mission, au beau milieu du champ
de bataille. Le rugissement des canons et
des coups de feu ponctuait les tnbres.
Les conditions taient extrmement
difficiles. Personne n'chappait aux
blessures et les cadavres gisaient partout.
C'tait l'enfer. Je me baissai instinctivement,
sentant une balle passer  quelques
centimtres. A ce moment-l, le Codec
sonna. C'tait Rose.
"Veux-tu... Jack ? Et la mission ?"
"Je suis en plein dedans !"
"Oh, c'est vrai."
"Qu'y a-t-il?"
Rose hsita un moment avant de parler.
"... Il faut que je te parle."
"Vraiment ?"
"Oui, c'est trs important. On en parlera
demain."
Pourquoi me parlait-elle d'un truc dont elle
voulait discuter le lendemain ? Troubl, je
lui posai la question.
"Pourquoi pas maintenant ?"
Rose dit trs vite :
"D'accord, je vais te le dire. Jack... je... je
suis..."
Un lourd silence s'installa. Finalement, Rose
sembla se dcider.
"... Je pense que je grossis ! J'ai des
poignes d'amour. Que dois-je faire ?"
"Que dois-tu faire...? Je n'ai rien
remarqu !"
"Vraiment ? Mais ma vieille jupe me serre
maintenant..."
"Si a t'embte tant que a, pourquoi ne pas
faire de l'exercice ? J'en ferai avec toi si tu
veux."
"Super ! Du jogging, a te dit ? Oh, avant
que j'oublie, ta mission consiste 
neutraliser tous les ennemis et  arriver au
but. Bonne chance."#C0

column2:
Rose et moi dnions dans un restaurant au
bord de la rivire. Rose tait ravissante,
comme toujours. Ses jolies joues taient
vermeilles  cause du vin. Au moment du
plat de rsistance, le Colonel se prcipita 
notre table.
"Raiden, il m'est arriv quelque chose jeudi
dernier..."
"Quoi donc, Colonel ? Des extra-terrestres
vous ont encore enlev ?" Le Colonel se
fcha.
"Des extra-terrestres !? Mais a n'existe
pas ! C'est inconcevable."
"Alors, dites-moi ?"
En essayant visiblement de se calmer, le
Colonel raconta son histoire.
"Ecoutez. Derrire chez moi, il y a un
champ d'orge. Jeudi soir, j'ai vu quelque
chose, des trucs qui brillaient dans le
champ. Lorsque je m'y suis rendu le
lendemain, j'ai dcouvert d'normes motifs
circulaires trs complexes dans l'orge...
Qu'en pensez-vous ?"
"Heu ?"
Je ne trouvais plus mes mots mais Rose
rpondit  ma place.
"Je pense que c'est un genre de message."
Le Colonel dit d'une voix tremblante :
"C'est ce que je pensais. J'aurai donc
besoin de ciseaux... Bon, votre mission
consiste  dtruire toutes les cibles et 
atteindre le but. Soyez prudent."#C0

column2:
En dbut d'aprs-midi, Rose et moi
marchions dans le parc. La lumire du soleil
filtrait  travers la cime des arbres. Nous
nous dirigemes vers un tang et nous
assmes sur un banc. Alors que j'enlaais
Rose, quelqu'un bondit de l'tang en
poussant un cri bizarre. C'tait Vamp ! Il
sortit un couteau et le lana droit sur nous.
Tout en protgeant Rose, je sortis mon
pistolet et dtruisis le couteau. Je continuai
 tirer. Une balle l'atteignit entre les yeux et
il tomba. Mais il se releva en gmissant.
J'entendis la voix tremblante de Rose.
"Ce n'est pas vrai... Comment...?"
Tout en lchant une goutte de sang de sa
longue langue, Vamp dit :
"Je suis dj mort une fois. Alors a suffit."
Rose hocha la tte.
"Bon, je suppose qu'il n'y a rien  y faire."
En poussant un autre cri, Vamp se prcipita
vers l'tang. Il atterrit directement sur sa
surface et le traversa en criant :
"Votre mission consiste  tuer tous les
ennemis et  atteindre le but.
MAINTENANT !"#C0

filtrait  travers la cime des arbres. Nous
nous dirigemes vers un tang et nous
assmes sur un banc. Alors que j'enlaais
Rose, quelqu'un bondit de l'tang en
poussant un cri bizarre. C'tait Vamp ! Il
sortit un couteau et le lana droit sur nous.
Tout en protgeant Rose, je sortis mon
pistolet et dtruisis le couteau. Je continuai
 tirer. Une balle l'atteignit entre les yeux et
il tomba. Mais il se releva en gmissant.
J'entendis la voix tremblante de Rose.
"Ce n'est pas vrai... Comment...?"
Tout en lchant une goutte de sang de sa
longue langue, Vamp dit :
"Je suis dj mort une fois. Alors a suffit."
Rose hocha la tte.
"Bon, je suppose qu'il n'y a rien  y faire."
En poussant un autre cri, Vamp se prcipita
vers l'tang. Il atterrit directement sur sa
surface et le traversa en criant :
"Votre mission consiste  tuer tous les
ennemis et  atteindre le but.
MAINTENANT !"#C0

column2:
Rose et moi regardions un film de monstres
dans sa chambre. Soudain, l'cran se
remplit de parasites.

"C'est fichu ?"
Au moment o je me levais du lit, l'cran
plein de parasites commena  parler.
"Raiden, nous reois-tu ? On est encore
l."
"Le La-li-lu-le-lo !?"
Rose tait sous le choc. Le La-li-lu-le-lo
continua :
"Raiden. Tu veux savoir qui on est, pas
vrai ?" Je sautai du lit surpris. Le
La-li-lu-le-lo laissa chapper une espce
de rire.
"H, h. Comme tu le sais, on n'est pas
vraiment des humains. Mais tu sais quoi ?
Il y a plein de taches dans les toilettes :
urine sche, taches jaunes, taches d'eau...
Il faut tout le temps les nettoyer. T'es pas
d'accord ?"
"Qu'est-ce que vous racontez !?"
A ce moment l, j'entendis une autre voix
provenant de la radio qui tait teinte.
"Raiden, nous reois-tu ? On est encore
l."
"Le Ta-ti-tu-te-to ! Jack ! C'est le
Ta-ti-tu-te-to !" cria Rose.
Le Ta-ti-tu-te-to dit :
"H, h, h. On a quelques conseils
concernant les taches jaunes. D'abord,
placez du papier toilette sur la tache, puis
versez du dtergent. Laissez agir quelques
minutes, puis frottez bien... avec le papier."
"Mais... !?"
Le mot tait  peine sorti de ma bouche que
le rpondeur commena  parler.
"Raiden, nous reois-tu ? On est encore
l."
"Le I-ro-ha-ni-ho-he-to !? Oh non, Jack !
Qu'est-ce qu'on fait !?"
Rose me tenait le bras. Elle tremblait. Je la
serrai. Le I-ro-ha-ni-ho-he-to dit :
"Surtout, il ne faut pas oublier le rebord, 
l'intrieur des toilettes. L'urine y gicle."
Le La-li-lu-le-lo intervint.
"Mettez des gants et utilisez une ponge ou
un chiffon dans les endroits difficiles 
atteindre avec la brosse."
Le Ta-ti-tu-te-to continua.
"Une vieille brosse  dents pourrait faire
l'affaire."
Le I-ro-ha-ni-ho-he-to parla plus fort.
"N'oubliez pas de nettoyer l'extrieur des
toilettes ni le sol. Si vous laissez des taches
d'urine, a sentira mauvais."
Je criai une question.
"Qu'est-ce que tout a a  voir avec qui
vous tes !?"
"RIEN !!!" rtorqua le La-li-lu-le-lo. J'tais
sans voix.
"Heu, alors... O voulez-vous en venir ?"
Tous les trois rpondirent en mme temps.
"H, h, h... C'est trs simple."
Le La-li-lu-le-lo dit :
"Cette fois..."
Le Ta-ti-tu-te-to dit :
"... Ta ..."
Le I-ro-ha-ni-ho-he-to dit :
"... mission est ..."
Rose dit :
"... d'atteindre le but sans tre dcouvert.
Bonne chance !"#C0

column2:
Une lueur aveuglante m'enveloppa, puis je
fus jet dans un immense espace dont le sol
tait mystrieusement illumin. J'entendis la
voix d'Otacon.
"Snake ! Snake !! a va !?"
Je secouai la tte pour soulager un lger
mal de tte. Il me semblait avoir rv
pendant des sicles. "J'ai compltement
repris le contrle du systme de RV 
Solidus !" dit Otacon agit.
"C'est bien. Alors, o est la
particularit...?"
"Je l'ai trouve ! Elle est l ! Tu es dedans
! On peut ramener l'univers  la normale,
maintenant !" A ce moment-l, je sentis
quelque chose d'norme venir de devant. Un
Metal Gear RAY mergea des tnbres.
Puis un deuxime, puis d'autre, les uns
aprs les autres. Otacon s'cria :
"C'est la dernire tentative de Solidus pour
nous arrter ! J'ai besoin d'un peu plus de
temps. Tiens bon !"
Les RAY de Metal Gear se rapprochrent.
Je les affrontai. Je devais lutter jusqu' ce
qu'Otacon ait finit.#C0

column2:
A mon rveil, je me retrouvai dans ce que
Solidus avait appel le vide entre les univers
parallles. La voix heureuse d'Otacon me
parvint.
"Snake ! On a russi ! Tout s'est trs bien
pass de mon ct ! L'espace a commenc
 se rparer !"
"Exactement comme avant ?" dis-je dans le
vide.
"Je crois. Tu devrais bientt revenir dans
notre univers. Les rparations ont l'air de se
faire par squence. a peut prendre du
temps avant que tout ne rentre dans
l'ordre..."
"SNAKE !!" C'tait la voix furieuse de
Solidus.
Il y eut un clair et lorsque j'ouvris les yeux,
j'tais en haut du Federal Hall en ruines,
avec Solidus. Solidus tira ses pes.
Je dis :
"Arrte ! C'est fini. L'univers est en train de
se rparer."
"Non, ce n'est pas fini. Si je te tue ici, il y
aura au moins un univers o je survis qui
sera dfini !"
"Arrte ! Il doit y avoir un autre moyen !
Je retourne dans mon univers. Je n'ai pas
l'intention d'interfrer avec le tien. Inutile de
se battre !!"
Mais Solidus se moqua de moi et brandit
ses pes. Il me fixa d'un regard perant et
menaant. "Assez parl ! LUTTE !!"#C0

du toit du Federal Hall. Je lui tendis la main,
mais en vain. Le corps de Solidus tomba en
silence. Je ne pouvais rien faire. Au moment
o son corps toucha le sol, une puissante
lueur aveuglante m'enveloppa.#C0
